element.name: a

browser.description: IE 5-6 only supports :hover on links.

element.description: Defines the properties for a link or a target.
element.example:
This example shows a set styles of anchor elements that will visually change color and text-decoration depending on state and mouse behavior:


a {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:active {
	color: yellow;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:link {
	color: blue;
	text-decoration: underline;
}

a:visited {
	color: purple;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:focus {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}

a:hover {
	color: red;
	text-decoration: none;
}
element.remarks: Combine different anchor styles to create visual cues for your links.

element.name: abbr
element.description: Defines the properties for an abbreviation.
element.example:
This example sets the style for all abbreviations:


abbr {
  border-bottom: 1px dashed #000;
}

element.name: address
element.description: Defines the properties for an address.
element.example:
This example sets the style for all addresses:


address {
  font-style: italic
}

element.name: area
element.description: Defines the properties for a clickable area on an image.
element.example:
This example sets the style for all areas:


area {
  display: inline-block
}

element.name: article
element.description: Defines the properties for an article.

element.name: aside
element.description: Defines the properties for an aside element.

element.name: audio
element.description: Defines the properties for an audio player.

element.name: b
element.description: Defines the properties for bold text.
element.example:
This example styles a "b" element to have its font-weight be "bolder" than the default boldface font:


b {
	font-weight:bolder;
}
element.remarks: You will not usually need to style a "b" element unless you want bold text rendered differently than the default bold face style.

element.name: base
element.description: Defines the properties for a base url.

element.name: bdo
element.description: Defines the properties for text direction for the document.

element.name: blockquote
element.description: Defines the properties for a blockquote.
element.example:
This example adds padding around a blockquote and sets the left margin at 10px:


blockquote {
	margin-left: 10px;
	padding: 5px;
}
element.remarks: Common style settings for blockquote elements include changes to margins and padding.

element.name: body
element.description: Defines the properties for the document Body.
element.example:
This example sets the default font and background image as a vertically repeating gif image for the body of a document:


body {
	font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	background-image: url(images/nachos.gif);
	background-repeat:repeat-y;
}
element.remarks: Common style settings for blockquote elements include changes to margins and padding.

element.name: br
element.description: Defines the properties for a hard line break in the text.

element.name: button
element.description: Defines the properties for a clickable Button.

element.name: canvas
element.description: Defines the properties for a scriptable bitmap canvas.

element.name: caption
element.description: Defines the properties for a caption within a table.

element.name: cite
element.description: Defines the properties for a citation.

element.name: code
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of text formatted as code.
element.example:
This example sets the font for code elements to the Courier font family and decreases the font size by one:


code {
	font-family:"Courier New", Courier, monospace;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: The standard font for code samples is courier or another similar monospace font.

element.name: col
element.description: Defines the properties for a table column.

element.name: colgroup
element.description: Defines the properties for a table column group.

element.name: command
element.description: Defines the properties for a command.

element.name: datalist
element.description: Defines the properties for a container for options within a combo box control.

element.name: dd
element.description: Defines the properties for a definition in a definition list.

element.name: del
element.description: Defines the properties for deleted text.

element.name: details
element.description: Defines the properties for details about a document.

element.name: dfn
element.description: Defines the properties for a definition of a term.

element.name: div
element.description: Defines the properties for a pre-defined content block in a document.
element.example:
This example colors the background for all divs yellow and gives them a red font:


div {
	background-color: yellow;
	color: red;
}
element.remarks: Usually, you will assign a class or id to a div to style it, rather than styling all divs.

element.name: dl
element.description: Defines the properties for a list of definitions.

element.name: dt
element.description: Defines the properties for a list of definition terms in a list.

element.name: em
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of text block of text that is formatted for emphasis.
element.example:
This sets the font for em elements to italic:


em {
	font-style:italic;
}
element.remarks: Usually, em elements should be rendered in italics.

element.name: embed
element.description: Defines the properties for an embeded object.

element.name: fieldset
element.description: Defines a set of related form controls to be grouped together.
element.example:
This example places a border around a fieldset:


fieldset {
	border-color: navy;
	border-style: double;
	border-width: thin;
}
element.remarks: Use <fieldset> </fieldset> tags to group form controls together for usability and tabbing.

element.name: figcaption
element.description: Defines the properties for a figure caption.

element.name: figure
element.description: Defines the properties for a figure.

element.name: footer
element.description: Defines the properties for a footer of a section or document.

element.name: form
element.description: Defines the properties for a form.
element.example:
This example places a border around all form elements and sets the default font for any text in a form:


form {
	border-color: navy;
	border-style: double;
	border-width: thin;
	font-family:"Times New Roman", Times, serif;
}
element.remarks: You can also use divs and tables to help style your forms.

element.name: h1
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 1 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h1 element:


h1 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 24pt;
	color: navy;
	padding-top: 12px;
	padding-bottom: 3px;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: h2
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 2 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h2 element:


h2 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 20pt;
	color: navy;
	padding-top: 12px;
	padding-bottom: 3px;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: h3
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 3 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h3 element:


h3 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 18pt;
	color: navy;
	padding-top: 10px;
	padding-bottom: 3px;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: h4
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 4 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h4 element:


h4 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 14pt;
	color: navy;
	padding-top: 6px;
	padding-bottom: 0px;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: h5
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 5 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h5 element:


h5 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 12pt;
	color: black;
	padding-top: 3px;
	padding-bottom: 0px;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: h6
element.description: Defines the properties for a Heading 6 element.
element.example:
This example styles an h6 element:


h6 {
	font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 10pt;
	font-weight: bold;
	color: black;
}
element.remarks: You can specify different amounts of padding above and below a heading to group it visually with other elements.

element.name: head
element.description: Defines the properties for a Document Head.

element.name: header
element.description: Defines the properties for an introduction to the document.

element.name: hgroup
element.description: Defines the properties for a header group.

element.name: hr
element.description: Defines the properties for a horizontal rule.
element.example:
This example styles an hr element:


hr {
	color: red;
	padding-top: 10px;
	padding-bottom: 10px;
}
element.remarks: You can use CSS styles to change things such as the the color and amount of padding around a horizontal rule.

element.name: html
element.description: Defines the properties for a HTML document.

element.name: i
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of text formatted as italics.
element.example:
This example adds an underline to all text enclosed by the "i" element:


i {
	text-decoration: underline;
}
element.remarks: You will not usually need to style the "i" element differently than its default settings.

element.name: iframe
element.description: Defines the properties for an inline frame.

element.name: img
element.description: Defines the properties for an image object.

element.name: input
element.description: Defines the properties for an input field on a form.
element.example:
This example adds a border and padding around all input elements:


input {
	border-color: black;
	border-style: solid;
	border-width: thin;
	padding: 3px;
}
element.remarks: You will usually use classes and id's to style individual input elements, rather than styling all input elements at once.

element.name: ins
element.description: Defines the properties for inserted text.

element.name: kbd
element.description: Defines the properties for keyboard input.

element.name: keygen
element.description: Defines the properties for a generated key.

element.name: label
element.description: Defines a label on a form.
element.example:
This example adds a border and padding around a form label:


label {
	border-color: black;
	border-style: solid;
	border-width: thin;
	padding: 3px;
}
element.remarks: In addition to <fieldset> </fieldset>, <label> </label>, and <legend> </legend> elements, you can use <table> </table> and <div> </div> elements to improve the layout of a form.

element.name: legend
element.description: Defines a legend for the fields on a form.
element.example:
This example adds a border and padding around a form legend:


legend {
	border-color: black;
	border-style: solid;
	border-width: thin;
	padding: 3px;
}
element.remarks: In addition to <fieldset> </fieldset>, <label> </label>, and <legend> </legend> elements, you can use <table> </table> and <div> </div> elements to improve the layout of a form.

element.name: li
element.description: Defines the properties for an item in a list.
element.example:
This example sets the style for all list items to "square":


li {
	list-style-type:square;
}
element.remarks: Style rules for "li" elements will apply to elements in both ordered and unordered lists.

element.name: link
element.description: Defines the properties for a link.

element.name: map
element.description: Defines the properties for an image map.

element.name: mark
element.description: Defines the properties for marked text.

element.name: menu
element.description: Defines the properties for a list of commands.

element.name: meta
element.description: Defines the properties for a meta element.

element.name: meter
element.description: Defines the properties for a meter.

element.name: nav
element.description: Defines the properties for a navigation element.

element.name: noscript
element.description: Defines the properties for a noscript element.

element.name: object
element.description: Defines the properties for an object embedded in the document.

element.name: ol
element.description: Defines the properties for an ordered list.
element.example:
This example sets the style for all ordered lists to lower-case alphabet characters:


ol {
	list-style-type: lower-alpha;
}
element.remarks: Style rules for "li" elements will apply to elements in both ordered and unordered lists. Use "ol" and "ul" styles to set the styles for the two list types separately.

element.name: optgroup
element.description: Specifies a grouping of option elements within a select element.
element.example:
This example places a border around an optgroup:


optgroup {
	border-color: navy;
	border-style: double;
	border-width: thin;
}
element.remarks: <optgroup></optgroup> tags should always be nested within a <select></select> element.

element.name: option
element.description: Specifies an option in a select (selection list) element.
element.example:
This example places a border around an option:


option {
	border-color: navy;
	border-style: double;
	border-width: thin;
}
element.remarks: <option></option> tags should always be nested within a <select></select> element.

element.name: output
element.description: Defines the properties for output element.

element.name: p
element.description: Defines the properties for a paragraph element.
element.example:
This example sets the font family and size for paragraph text and adds padding to bottom of a paragraph:


p {
	font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	font-size: 10pt;
	padding-bottom: 3px;
}
element.remarks: Setting the font characteristics for your "p" elements will also set those characteristics for elements such as "b", and "i" that will inherit attributes such as "font-family" from the parent "p" tag.

element.name: param
element.description: Defines the properties for param element.

element.name: pre
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of preformatted text.
element.example:
This example sets the font for preformatted elements to the Courier font family and decreases the font size by one:


pre {
	font-family:"Courier New", Courier, monospace;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: Since the "pre" tag is often used to designate code samples, you will often set the font for preformatted text to courier or another similar monospace font.

element.name: progress
element.description: Defines the properties for the completion progress of a task.

element.name: q
element.description: Defines the properties for a quote.

element.name: rp
element.description: Defines the properties for rp element.

element.name: rt
element.description: Defines the properties for rt element.

element.name: ruby
element.description: Defines the properties for ruby element.

element.name: samp
element.description: Defines the properties for sample text.

element.name: script
element.description: Defines the properties for script element.

element.name: section
element.description: Defines the properties for a generic section of a document or application.

element.name: select
element.description: Defines the properties for select element.

element.name: small
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of text one font size smaller than the base font.
element.example:
This example sets the font for "small" text to a fixed size of 8pt:


small {
	font-size: 8pt;
}
element.remarks: By default, "small" sets the size of a font to one size smaller relative to the parent element.

element.name: source
element.description: Defines the properties for source element.

element.name: span
element.description: Defines the properties for a pre-defined text span element.
element.example:
This example sets the background color for all span elements to red:


span {
	background-color: red;
}
element.remarks: You will usually style individual span elements by assigning classes and id's to them and styling those. Assigning the same styles to all span elements usually is not very useful.

element.name: strong
element.description: Defines the properties for a block of text formatted as "strong."
element.example:
This example sets the font-weight for all "strong" elements to "bolder", which is darker than the standard "bold":


strong {
	font-weight: bolder;
}
element.remarks: You will usually style individual span elements by assigning classes and id's to them and styling those. Assigning the same styles to all span elements usually is not very useful.

element.name: style
element.description: Defines the properties for stylesheet within the document.

element.name: sub
element.description: Defines the properties for subscript element.

element.name: summary
element.description: Defines the properties for summary element.

element.name: sup
element.description: Defines the properties for superscript.

element.name: table
element.description: Defines the properties for a table.
element.example:
This example specifies that all tables should have top and bottom borders, but no left or right borders. It also sets the font-size to one size smaller than the parent element text:


table {
	border-bottom: navy solid thin;
	border-top: navy solid thin;
	border-left: none;
	border-right: none;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: When you style table elements, you will usually be setting things like border styles and padding.

element.name: tbody
element.description: Defines the properties for table body element.

element.name: td
element.description: Defines the properties for an individual table cell.
element.example:
This example specifies that all table cells should have top and bottom borders, but no left or right borders. It also sets the font-size to one size smaller than the parent element text:


td {
	border-bottom: navy solid thin;
	border-top: navy solid thin;
	border-left: none;
	border-right: none;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: Because table cells are children of "table" and "tr" elements, they will inherit some of their styles from those elements.

element.name: textarea
element.description: Defines the properties for a textarea input field on a form.
element.example:
This example adds a border and padding around all textarea elements:


textarea {
	border-color: black;
	border-style: solid;
	border-width: thin;
	padding: 3px;
}
element.remarks: You will usually use classes and id's to style individual textarea elements, rather than styling all textarea elements at once.

element.name: tfoot
element.description: Defines the properties for table footer element.

element.name: th
element.description: Defines the properties for a table header cell.
element.example:
This example specifies that all table header cells should have top and bottom borders, but no left or right borders. It also sets the font-size to one size smaller than the parent element text:


th {
	border-bottom: navy solid thin;
	border-top: navy solid thin;
	border-left: none;
	border-right: none;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: Because table header cells are children of "table" and "tr" elements, they will inherit some of their styles from those elements.

element.name: thead
element.description: Defines the properties for table header element.

element.name: time
element.description: Defines the properties for time element.

element.name: title
element.description: Defines the properties for the title of an HTML document.

element.name: tr
element.description: Defines the properties for a table row.
element.example:
This example specifies that all table rows should have top and bottom borders, but no left or right borders. It also sets the font-size to one size smaller than the parent element text:


tr {
	border-bottom: navy solid thin;
	border-top: navy solid thin;
	border-left: none;
	border-right: none;
	font-size: smaller;
}
element.remarks: Because table rows are children of "table" elements, they will inherit some of their styles from those elements.

element.name: ul
element.description: Defines the properties for an unordered list.
element.example:
This example sets the style for all unordered lists to "square":


li {
	list-style-type: square;
}
element.remarks: Style rules for "li" elements will apply to elements in both ordered and unordered lists. Use "ol" and "ul" styles to set the styles for the two list types separately.

element.name: var
element.description: Defines the properties for a variable.

element.name: video
element.description: Defines the properties for a video.

element.name: wbr
element.description: Defines the properties for a word break.

property.name: -moz-binding
property.description: Specifies the URL of an XBL file to bind to the element.

property.name: -moz-border-bottom-colors
property.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the bottom border of the element.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: -moz-border-left-colors
property.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the left border of the element.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: -moz-border-radius
property.description: Specifies the radius of the border around the element.
property.remarks:
Use the border-style property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual -moz-border-radius properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-style- property as part of border-style.

You can specify up to four different border styles for the border of an element.

  • For a border radius that is the same on all four corners, specify a single value.
  • For a border radius that is different on the top-left/bottom-right and top-right/bottom-left corners, specify two values with the top-left/bottom-right value first.
  • For a border radius that are different on the top-left, top-rightright/bottom-left, and bottom-right corners, specify three values in the order of top-left, top-rightright/bottom-left, and bottom-right.
  • For a border radius with four different corners, specify four values in the order of top-left, top-rightright, bottom-right, and bottom-left.

property.name: -moz-border-radius-bottomleft
property.description: Specifies the border radius of the bottom-left corner of the element.

property.name: -moz-border-radius-bottomright
property.description: Specifies the border radius of the bottom-right corner of the element.

property.name: -moz-border-radius-topleft
property.description: Specifies the border radius of the top-left corner of the element.

property.name: -moz-border-radius-topright
property.description: Specifies the border radius of the top-right corner of the element.

property.name: -moz-border-right-colors
property.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the right border of the element.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: -moz-border-top-colors
property.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the top border of the element.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: -moz-opacity
property.description: Specifies the level of opacity for the element. Use a two-digit decimal.
property.hint: [0-1.0] 0 is completely transparent, while 1.0 is completely solid.

property.name: -moz-outline
property.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline property. Defines the properties for an outline drawn over the outer edge of an element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: #ffffff
value.description: outline-color: Color placeholder. e.g. #ffffff = white

value.name: none
value.description: outline-style: No outline.

value.name: dotted
value.description: outline-style: Dotted line.

value.name: dashed
value.description: outline-style: Dashed line.

value.name: solid
value.description: outline-style: Solid line.

value.name: double
value.description: outline-style: Double line.

value.name: groove
value.description: outline-style: Grooved line.

value.name: ridge
value.description: outline-style: Ridged line.

value.name: inset
value.description: outline-style: Inset line.

value.name: outset
value.description: outline-style: Outset line.

value.name: hidden
value.description: outline-style: Hidden outline.

value.name: thin
value.description: outline-width: Thin outline.

value.name: medium
value.description: outline-width: Medium outline.

value.name: thick
value.description: outline-width: Thick outline.

property.name: -moz-outline-color
property.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline-color property that specifies the color for an outline. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: -moz-outline-style
property.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline-style property that specifies a style for an outline.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: No outline.

value.name: dotted
value.description: Dotted line.

value.name: dashed
value.description: Dashed line.

value.name: solid
value.description: Solid line.

value.name: double
value.description: Double line.

value.name: groove
value.description: Grooved line.

value.name: ridge
value.description: Ridged line.

value.name: inset
value.description: Inset line.

value.name: outset
value.description: Outset line.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Hidden outline.

property.name: -moz-outline-width
property.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline-width property that specifies the width of the outline.

value.description: Specify an outline width value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: thin
value.description: Thin outline.

value.name: medium
value.description: Medium outline.

value.name: thick
value.description: Thick outline.

property.name: -moz-user-focus
property.description: Specifies the behavior of the element when it receives focus.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Use the default focus behavior.

value.name: normal
value.description: Default focus behavior.

value.name: none
value.description: Element cannot receive focus.

value.name: ignore
value.description: Ignore focus.

property.name: -moz-user-input
property.description: Specifies whether or not the element has input focus.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Use the default user-input behavior.

value.name: none
value.description: Element is neither enabled or disabled for user input.

value.name: enabled
value.description: Element is enabled for user input.

value.name: disabled
value.description: Element is disabled for user input.

property.name: -moz-user-modify
property.description: Specifies if a user can change the contents of the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: read-only
value.description: Element contents are read-only.

value.name: read-write
value.description: Element contents are read-write.

value.name: write-only
value.description: Element contents are write-only. (e.g. Password field)

property.name: -moz-user-select
property.description: Specifies the content selection behavior for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: Content of the element cannot be selected.

value.name: text
value.description: Text content of the element can be selected.

value.name: element
value.description: One element at a time can be selected.

value.name: elements
value.description: Multiple elements can be selected.

value.name: all

value.description: For each glyph corresponding to textual information within the element, the alignment-point is the intersection of the start-edge of the glyph box and the block-progression-direction position of the alignment point from the font. Padding, border or margin do not affect that alignment point.

value.name: text-after-edge
value.description: The alignment point is at the intersection of the start-edge of the element and the 'text-after-edge' baseline of the element.

value.name: ideographic

value.description: The alignment point is at the intersection of the start-edge of the element and the 'alphabetic' baseline of the element.

value.name: hanging
value.description: The alignment point is at the intersection of the start-edge of the element and the 'hanging' baseline of the element.

value.name: mathematical
value.description: The alignment point is at the intersection of the start-edge of the element and the 'mathematical' baseline of the element.

value.name: <percentage>
value.description: The computed value of the property is this percentage multiplied by the computed 'line-height' of the element. The alignment point is on the start-edge of the inline box. Its position along the start-edge relative to the intersection of the dominant-baseline and the start-edge is offset by the computed value.

value.name: <length>
value.description: The alignment-point is on the start-edge of the inline box. Its position along the start-edge relative to the intersection of the dominant-baseline and the start-edge is offset by the 'length' value.

property.name: alignment-baseline
property.description: Specifies how an inline-level element is aligned with respect to its parent.

value.name: baseline
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the dominant baseline of the parent.

value.name: use-script
value.description: If the element 'script' property value is 'auto', the alignment point of each glyph is aligned with the baseline-identifier of the script to which the glyph belongs. If the element 'script' property value is other than 'auto', the alignment point of each glyph is aligned with the baseline-identifier specified by the 'script' property. The baseline-identifier position is determined by using the relevant information related to the parent element dominant-baseline set. The alignment point of the element itself is aligned as for the 'baseline' value.

value.name: before-edge
value.description: The alignment point of the box is aligned with the 'before-edge' baseline of the line box.

value.name: text-before-edge
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the 'text-before-edge' baseline of the parent.

value.name: after-edge
value.description: The alignment point of the box is aligned with the 'after-edge' baseline of the line box.

value.name: text-after-edge
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the 'text-after-edge' baseline of the parent.

value.name: central
value.description: The alignment point of the box is aligned with the 'central' baseline of the parent.

value.name: middle
value.description: The alignment point of the box is aligned with the 'middle' baseline of the parent.

value.name: ideographic
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the 'ideographic' baseline of the parent.

value.name: alphabetic
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the lower baseline of the parent.

value.name: hanging
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the hanging baseline of the parent.

value.name: mathematical
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the mathematical baseline of the parent.

property.name: animation
property.description: Specifies a shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

property.name: animation-delay
property.description: Specifies when the animation will start. It allows an animation to begin execution some time after it is applied.

property.name: animation-direction
property.description: Specifies whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

value.name: normal
value.description: The animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate
value.description: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

property.name: animation-duration
property.description: Specifies the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

property.name: animation-iteration-count
property.description: Specifies the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once. A value of infinite will cause the animation to repeat forever. Non-integer numbers will cause the animation to end part-way through a cycle.

property.name: animation-name
property.description: Specifies a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

property.name: animation-timing-function
property.description: Specifies how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration.

property.name: animation-play-state
property.description: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

property.name: appearance
property.description: Specifies a property which can be used to make an element look like a standard user interface element on the platform

property.name: azimuth
property.description: Specifies the speaker balance for audio content.
property.remarks: To specify an angle, use syntax similar to "90deg".

value.description: Specify a value for azimuth that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: left-side
value.description: Same as 270deg.

value.name: far-left
value.description: Same as 300deg.

value.name: left
value.description: Same as 320deg.

value.name: center-left
value.description: Same as 340deg.

value.name: center
value.description: Same as 0deg.

value.name: center-right
value.description: Same as 20deg.

value.name: right
value.description: Same as 40deg.

value.name: far-right
value.description: Same as 60deg.

value.name: right-side
value.description: Same as 90deg

value.name: behind
value.description: Same as 180deg.

value.name: leftwards
value.description: Subtracts 20deg from the current angle.

value.name: rightwards
value.description: Adds 20deg to the current angle.

property.name: backface-visibility
property.description: Determines whether or not the "back" side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer.

property.name: background
property.description: Defines the background properties for an element.
property.example: To specify a background image in an "images" directory named myCat.jpg that repeats vertically, use the following syntax: body {background: url(images/myCat.jpg), repeat-y}.
property.remarks: Use the background property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual background properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a background- property as part of background.

value.description: Specify a value for background that is not on this list.

value.name: #ffffff
value.description: background-color: Background color placeholder. e.g. #ffffff = white

value.name: url(image-url.gif)
value.description: background-image: Background image placeholder

value.name: none
value.description: background-image: No background image.

value.name: inherit

value.name: scroll
value.description: background-attachment:Background image scrolls with the document.

value.name: fixed
value.description: background-attachment:Background image is fixed as the document scrolls.

value.name: top
value.description: background-position: Top of the parent element or window.

value.name: center
value.description: background-position: Center of the parent element or window.

value.name: bottom
value.description: background-position: Bottom of the parent element or window.

value.name: left
value.description: background-position: Left edge of the parent element or window.

value.name: right
value.description: background-position: Right edge of the parent element or window.

value.name: repeat
value.description: background-repeat: Image repeats both horizontally and vertically.

value.name: repeat-x
value.description: background-repeat: Image repeats horizontally.

value.name: repeat-y
value.description: background-repeat: Image repeats vertically.

value.name: no-repeat
value.description: background-repeat: Image does not repeat.

property.name: background-attachment

browser.description: IE uses the value "local" instead of "scroll".

property.description: Specifies whether or not the background image is fixed or scrollable as a user scrolls the document.
property.example:
For additional information and a demonstration of the background-attachment attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/background.html

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: scroll
value.description: Background image scrolls with the document.

value.name: fixed
value.description: Background image is fixed as the document scrolls.

property.name: background-clip
property.description: Determines the background painting area.

value.name: padding-box
value.description: The background is painted within (clipped to) the padding box.

value.name: border-box
value.description: The background is painted within (clipped to) the border box.

property.name: background-color
property.description: Specifies the background color for the element. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.example:
For additional information and a demonstration of the background-color attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/columns.html#background
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: background-image
property.description: Specifies the URL for a background image for an element.
property.example: To specify a background image in an "images" directory named myCat.jpg, use the following syntax: body {background-image: url(images/myCat.jpg)}.

property.name: background-origin
property.description: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes box-decoration-break operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

value.name: padding-box
value.description: The position is relative to the padding box.

value.name: border-box
value.description: The position is relative to the border box.

value.name: content-box
value.description: The position is relative to the content box.

property.name: background-position
property.description: Specifies the position of a background image for an element.
property.remarks: If you do not specify one or more of the values top, center, bottom, left, or right, you can also specify pixel values (px), percentage values (%), em, in, cm, mm, pt, and pc.

value.description: Specify a value for background-position not on this list.

value.name: top
value.description: Top of the parent element or window.

value.name: center
value.description: Center of the parent element or window.

value.name: bottom
value.description: Bottom of the parent element or window.

value.name: left
value.description: Left edge of the parent element or window.

value.name: right
value.description: Right edge of the parent element or window.

property.name: background-position-x
property.description: Specifies the x-position of a background image for an element.
property.hint: [length | percentage | horziontal-alignment]. Example values: 50px 50px, 10% 5%, 2cm 4cm, 2cm 5%, center, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for background-position-x not on this list.

value.name: center
value.description: Center of the parent element or window.

value.name: left
value.description: Left edge of the parent element or window.

value.name: right
value.description: Right edge of the parent element or window.

property.name: background-position-y
property.description: Specifies the y-position of a background image for an element.
property.hint: [length | percentage | vertical-alignment]. Example values: 50px 50px, 10% 5%, 2cm 4cm, 2cm 5%, center, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for background-position not on this list.

value.name: top
value.description: Top of the parent element or window.

value.name: center
value.description: Center of the parent element or window.

value.name: bottom
value.description: Bottom of the parent element or window.

property.name: background-repeat
property.description: Specifies how a background image repeats for an element.

value.name: repeat
value.description: Image repeats both horizontally and vertically.

value.name: repeat-x
value.description: Image repeats horizontally.

value.name: repeat-y
value.description: Image repeats vertically.

value.name: no-repeat
value.description: Image does not repeat.

property.name: background-size
property.description: Specifies the size of the background images.

value.name: contain
value.description: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

value.name: cover
value.description: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

property.name: baseline-shift
property.description: Allows repositioning of the dominant-baseline relative to the dominant-baseline. The shifted object might be a sub- or superscript. Within the shifted element, the whole baseline table is offset; not just a single baseline. For sub- and superscript, the amount of offset is determined from the nominal font of the parent.

value.name: baseline
value.description: There is no baseline shift; the dominant baseline remains in its original position.

value.name: sub
value.description: The dominant baseline is shifted to the default position for subscripts. The offset for this position is determined by the font data for the parent nominal font as adjusted by the dominant baseline-table font-size of the parent element. If there is no applicable font data the User Agent may use heuristic to determine the offset.

value.name: super
value.description: The dominant baseline is shifted to the default position for superscripts. The offset for this position is determined by the font data for the parent nominal font as adjusted by the dominant baseline-table font-size of the parent element. If there is no applicable font data the User Agent may use heuristic to determine the offset.

value.name: <percentage>
value.description: The computed value of the property is this percentage multiplied by the computed 'line-height' of the parent element. The dominant-baseline is shifted in the shift-direction (positive value) or opposite to the shift-direction (negative value) of the parent area by the computed value. A value of '0%' is equivalent to 'baseline'.

value.name: <length>
value.description: The dominant-baseline is shifted in the shift-direction (positive value) or opposite to the shift-direction (negative value) of the parent area by the 'length' value. A value of '0cm' is equivalent to 'baseline'.

property.name: binding
property.description: A property to attach a binding to a particular element.

value.name: none
value.description: No bindings are to be attached through CSS.

value.name: <uri>
value.description: The specified binding is attached. More than one binding can be specified, resulting in the bindings being attached in the specified order. The relevant language specification(s) define how multiple bindings interact. When the bindings interact through linear inheritance, the last binding specified must inherit from the previous one, and so forth, up to the first binding.

property.name: bookmark-label
property.description: This property specifies the label of the bookmark.

property.name: bookmark-level
property.description: This property specifies the label of the bookmark.

property.name: bookmark-target
property.description: This property specifies the target of the bookmark.

value.name: repeat
value.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.description: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.
