property.name: border-spacing
property.description: Specifies the number of pixels between the border and its contents.
property.example:
To specify 6px of space on the sides and 12px of spacing above and below and element, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border-spacing: 6px 12px;}.

For a demonstration of the empty-cells attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/tables.html#emptycells
property.remarks: To specify different values for horizontal and vertical spacing, specify two values with the horizontal value first.

property.name: border-style
property.description: Specifies a style for a border.
property.example: To specify a border style that is solid on top, ridged on the right and bottom, and solid on the left, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border-style: solid ridged ridged solid;}.
property.remarks:
Use the border-style property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-style properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-style- property as part of border-style.

You can specify up to four different border styles for the border of an element.

  • For border that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For border that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For border that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For border with four different styles, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: No border.

value.name: dotted
value.description: Dotted line.

value.name: dashed
value.description: Dashed line.

value.name: solid
value.description: Solid line.

value.name: double
value.description: Double line.

value.name: groove
value.description: Grooved line.

value.name: ridge
value.description: Ridged line.

value.name: inset
value.description: Inset line.

value.name: outset
value.description: Outset line.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Hidden border.

property.name: border-top
property.description: Defines the properties for the top border for the element.
property.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed top border, use the following syntax: .mybordertopclass {border-top: thick red dashed;}.
property.remarks: Use the border-top property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-top properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-top- property as part of border-top.

value.description: Specify a border-top value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: #ffffff
value.description: border-top-color: Border color placeholder. e.g. #ffffff = white

value.name: none
value.description: border-top-style: No border.

value.name: dotted
value.description: border-top-style: Dotted line.

value.name: dashed
value.description: border-top-style: Dashed line.

value.name: solid
value.description: border-top-style: Solid line.

value.name: double
value.description: border-top-style: Double line.

value.name: groove
value.description: border-top-style: Grooved line.

value.name: ridge
value.description: border-top-style: Ridged line.

value.name: inset
value.description: border-top-style: Inset line.

value.name: outset
value.description: border-top-style: Outset line.

value.name: hidden
value.description: border-top-style: Hidden border.

value.name: thin
value.description: border-top-width: Thin border.

value.name: medium
value.description: border-top-width: Medium border.

value.name: thick
value.description: border-top-width: Thick border.

property.name: border-top-color
property.description: Specifies the color for a top border. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: border-top-left-radius
property.description: Defines the top left radius of a quarter ellipse that defines the shape of the corner of the outer border edge.

property.name: border-top-right-radius
property.description: Defines the top right radius of a quarter ellipse that defines the shape of the corner of the outer border edge.

property.name: border-top-style
property.description: Specifies a style for a top border.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: No border.

value.name: dotted
value.description: Dotted line.

value.name: dashed
value.description: Dashed line.

value.name: solid
value.description: Solid line.

value.name: double
value.description: Double line.

value.name: groove
value.description: Grooved line.

value.name: ridge
value.description: Ridged line.

value.name: inset
value.description: Inset line.

value.name: outset
value.description: Outset line.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Hidden border.

property.name: border-top-width
property.description: Specifies the width of the top border.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-top-width.

value.description: Specify a border width value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: thin
value.description: Thin border.

value.name: medium
value.description: Medium border.

value.name: thick
value.description: Thick border.

property.name: border-width
property.description: Specifies the width of the border.
property.example: To specify a border width that is 2px on top, 1px on the right and bottom, and 2px on the left, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border-width: 2px 1px 1px 2px;}.
property.remarks:
You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-width.

You can specify up to four different widths for the border of an element.

  • For border that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For border that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For border that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For border with four different styles, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.

value.description: Specify a border width value not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: thin
value.description: Thin border.

value.name: medium
value.description: Medium border.

value.name: thick
value.description: Thick border.

property.name: bottom
property.description: Specifies the y-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the bottom edge of the parent element or browser window.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for bottom.

value.description: Specify a value for bottom that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Position as determined by window or parent element.

property.name: box-align
property.description: Specifies how a box's children are placed and aligned along the direction perpendicular to the box orientation, and where the extra space, if any, is positioned.

value.name: start
value.description: For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.

value.name: end
value.description: For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.

value.name: center
value.description: Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.

value.name: baseline
value.description: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.

value.name: stretch
value.description: The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.

property.name: box-direction
property.description: Specifies the direction in which children of a box are displayed.

value.name: normal
value.description: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.

value.name: reverse
value.description: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.

property.name: box-flex
property.description: Specifies a floating point value representing the flexibility of the element.

property.name: box-flex-group
property.description: Specifies a natural number value representing the flexibility of the flex group.

property.name: box-lines
property.description: By default a horizontal box will lay out its children in a single row, and a vertical box will lay out its children in a single column. This behavior can be changed using the box-lines property.

value.name: single
value.description: The box will lay out its children in a single row, and a single column. (default)

value.name: multiple
value.description: The box is allowed to expand to multiple lines (that is, multiple rows or columns) in order to accommodate all of its children

property.name: box-ordinal-group
property.description: Specifies the ordinal group of the box. This property has an initial value of 1.

property.name: box-orient
property.description: Specifies the orientation of the box.

value.name: horizontal
value.description: The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.

value.name: vertical
value.description: The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.

value.name: inline-axis
value.description: The box displays its children along the inline axis.

value.name: block-axis
value.description: The box displays its children along the block axis.

property.name: box-pack
property.description: When all of the elements within a box are inflexible or when all elements have grown to their maximum sizes and can stretch no further, extra space may be left over in the box. The box-pack property may be used to dictate how any additional space along the box-axis should be distributed between elements.

value.name: start
value.description: For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.

value.name: end
value.description: For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.

value.name: center
value.description: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

value.name: justify
value.description: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.

property.name: box-shadow
property.description: Specifies one or more drop-shadows to the box

property.name: box-sizing
property.description: Specifies the size of a box

value.name: content-box
value.description: This is the behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element. The padding and border of the element are laid out and drawn outside the specified width and height.

value.name: border-box
value.description: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element. That is, any padding or border specified on the element is laid out and drawn inside this specified width and height. The content width and height are calculated by subtracting the border and padding widths of the respective sides from the specified 'width' and 'height' properties. As the content width and height cannot be negative ([CSS21], section 10.2), this computation is floored at 0.

property.name: caption-side

browser.description: Only Mozilla supports the values "left" and "right".

property.description: Specifies the position of a caption for the element.
property.example:
For a demonstration of the caption-side attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/tables.html#captionside

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: top
value.description: Position the caption at the top of the element.

value.name: bottom
value.description: Position the caption at the bottom of the element.

value.name: left
value.description: Position the caption at the left side of the element.

value.name: right
value.description: Position the caption at the right side of the element.

property.name: clear
property.description: Specifies the position of the element relative to a floating object on the page.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: No specified position.

value.name: left
value.description: Positions the element to the left of the object.

value.name: right
value.description: Positions the element to the right of the object.

value.name: both
value.description: Clear the object until the element can reach both margins.

value.name: all
value.description: Clears all.

property.name: clip
property.description: Specifies the x- and y-coordinates (in pixels) for the clipping rectangle around the element.
property.hint: [rect(top-value right-value bottom-value left-value)]. Example values: rect(10px 25px 25px 10px).

value.description: Specify a value for clip that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Position as determined by the window or parent element.

property.name: color
property.description: Specifies the color of the text for the element. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: color-profile
property.description: This property permits the specification of a source color profile other than the default.

value.name: auto
value.description: This is the default behavior. All colors are presumed to be defined in the sRGB color space unless a more precise embedded profile is specified within content data. For images that do have a profile built into their data, that profile is used.

value.name: sRGB
value.description: The source profile is assumed to be sRGB. This differs from auto in that it overrides an embedded profile inside an image. For consistency with CSS lexical scanning and parsing rules, the keyword 'sRGB' is case-insensitive; however, it is recommended that the mixed capitalization 'sRGB' be used for consistency with common industry practice.

value.name: <name>
value.description: A name corresponding to a defined color profile that is in the user agent's color profile description database. The user agent searches the color profile description database for a color profile description entry whose name descriptor matches 'name' and uses the last matching entry that is found.

value.name: <url>
value.description: The location of a standard ICC profile resource. Just like specifying sRGB, it overrides an embedded profile.

property.name: column-count
property.description: This property describes the number of columns of a multicol element.

value.name: auto
value.description: The number of columns will be determined by other properties (e.g., column-width, if it has a non-auto value).

value.name: <integer>
value.description: describes the optimal number of columns into which the content of the element will be flowed. Values must be greater than 0. If both column-width and column-count have non-auto values, the integer value describes the maximum number of columns.

property.name: column-fill
property.description: This property describes how content will be filled in a column.

value.name: auto
value.description: Fills columns sequentially.

value.name: balance
value.description: Balance content equally between columns, if possible.

property.name: column-gap
property.description: Specifies the gap between columns.

value.name: normal
value.description: The normal value is UA-specific. A value of 1em is suggested.

value.name: <length>
value.description: Specify a non-negative value

property.name: columns-rule
property.description: Specifies a shorthand for setting column-rule-width, column-rule-style, and column-rule-color at the same place in the style sheet.

property.name: column-rule-color
property.description: This property sets the color of the column rule.

property.name: column-rule-style
property.description: Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.

property.name: column-rule-width
property.description: Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.

property.name: column-span
property.description: This property describes how many columns an element spans across.

value.description: The element does not span multiple columns.

value.name: all
value.description: The element spans across all columns. Content in the normal flow that appears before the element is automatically balanced across all columns before the element appears.

property.name: column-width
property.description: This property describes the width of columns in multicol elements.

value.name: auto
value.description: Signifies that the column width will be determined by other properties (e.g., column-count, if it has a non-auto value).

value.name: <length>
value.description: Describes the optimal column width. The actual column width may be wider (to fill the available space), or narrower (only if the available space is smaller than the specified column width). Values must be greater than 0.

property.name: columns
property.description: Specifies a shorthand property for setting column-width and column-count.

property.name: content
property.description: Specifies the content to insert before or after the element.
property.example: To specify that a paragraph should have an image from an "images" directory called "bluestar.gif" before it use the following syntax: p:before {content: url(images/bluestar.gif);}.
property.hint: [url(image-url) | quote-style-value]. Example values: url(images/bluestar.gif), "Chapter: ", open-quote, etc.
property.remarks: Use content to specify either a quote style or an image to use (similar to a bullet) before or after an element.

value.description: Specify a value for content that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: open-quote
value.description: Insert an open quote.

value.name: close-quote
value.description: Insert a close quote.

value.name: no-open-quote
value.description: Increment the nesting level of quotes, but do not insert quotes.

value.name: no-close-quote
value.description: Decrement the nesting level of quotes, but do not insert quotes.

property.name: counter-increment
property.description: Specifies a name of a counter and how much to increment the counter by.
property.example: To specify a level-1 section heading with an incremented Roman numeral before each heading, use the following syntax: H1:before {counter(section, upper-roman); counter-increment: section;}.
property.hint: [counter-name] [increment]. Example values: countby2 2, chapter, countbackwards -1, etc.
property.remarks: Use the counter-increment property for styles such as numbered headings.

value.description: Specify a value for counter-increment that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: No counter increment.

value.name: decimal
value.description: Increment a decimal. (e.g. 1, 2, 3, etc.

value.name: decimal-leading-zero
value.description: Increment a decimal with a leading zero. (e.g. 01, 02, 03, etc.)

value.name: lower-roman
value.description: Increment lower-case roman numerals. (e.g. i, ii, iii, etc.

value.name: upper-roman
value.description: Increment upper-case roman numerals. (e.g. I, II, III.)

value.name: lower-latin
value.description: Increment lower-case latin alphabet. (e.g. a, b, c, etc.)

value.name: upper-latin
value.description: Increment upper-case latin alphabet. (e.g. A, B, C, etc.)

value.name: lower-greek
value.description: Increment lower-case greek alphabet.

property.name: counter-reset
property.description: Resets a counter to the specified value.
property.example: To specify a level-1 section heading with an incremented Roman numeral before each heading and that sets a counter called "section" to "1" each time it occurs, use the following syntax: H1:before {counter(chapter, upper-roman); counter-increment: section; counter-reset section 1;}.

value.description: Specify a value for counter-reset that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: No reset.

property.name: crop
property.description: Allows a replaced element to be just a rectangular area of an object, instead of the whole object.

value.name: auto
value.description: The element's computed intrinsic width and height are the same as its actual intrinsic width and height.

value.name: rect(top, right, bottom, left)
value.description: Each of the four arguments can be a 'length' or a 'percentage'. All percentage values are computed relative to the intrinsic dimensions of the element, if there is one. Values are offsets relative to the top left of the element. The computed intrinsic width and height of the element are determined by subtracting the left from the right for the width, and similarly top from bottom for the height. However, if this computation results in a negative value, it is considered to be zero.

value.name: inset-rect(top, right, bottom, left)
value.description: Like rect(), except that the values are offsets relative to the respective edges of the element.

property.name: cue
property.description: Defines the properties for an aural cue before or after an element.
property.example: To specify a sound file named "bell.wav" before an H1 element and a sound file named "horns.wav", use the following syntax: H1 {cue: url("bell.wav") url("horns.wav");}.
property.remarks: Use the cue property as a shortcut to typing out both the cue-before and cue-after properties separately.

property.name: cue-after
property.description: Defines the properties for an aural cue after an element.
property.example: To specify a sound file named "horns.wav" after an H1 element, use the following syntax: H1 {cue: url("horns.wav");}.

property.name: cue-before
property.description: Defines the properties for an aural cue before an element.
property.example: To specify a sound file named "bell.wav" before an H1 element, use the following syntax: H1 {cue-before: url("bell.wav");}.

property.name: cursor

browser.description: Supports all W3C cursor values except for progress.

property.description: Specifies which cursor to display when a user mouses over the element.
property.example:
For a demonstration of the curosor attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/cursor.html
property.hint: [cursor-value | url(cursor-url)]. Example values: url(mycursor.cur), hand, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for cursor that is not on this list. (Safari does not support custom cursors.)

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Cursor to be determined by browser or user settings.

value.name: default
value.description: Default cursor (usually an arrow).

value.name: move
value.description: Four arrows cursor.

value.name: e-resize
value.description: East-west double arrow.

value.name: ne-resize
value.description: Northeast-southwest double arrow.

value.name: nw-resize
value.description: Northwest-southeast double arrow.

value.name: n-resize
value.description: North-south double arrow.

value.name: pointer
value.description: Default pointing cursor (usually a hand).

value.name: progress
value.description: Progress icon.

value.name: se-resize
value.description: Southeast-northwest double arrow.

value.name: sw-resize
value.description: Southwest-northeast double arrow.

value.name: s-resize
value.description: South-north double arrow.

value.name: w-resize
value.description: West-east double arrow.

value.name: text
value.description: I-bar cursor (Indicates text may be selected).

value.name: wait
value.description: Wait icon (usually an hourglass).

value.name: help
value.description: Help icon (usually a question mark).

property.name: direction
property.description: Specifies the text direction for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

property.name: display

browser.description: Support on IE 5/6 is incomplete. Support is almost complete on IE 7, beta 3. Compatibility depends only on the values block, inline, none, inline-block, and list-item.
Support on Firefox is incomplete. Compatibility depends only on the values block, inline, none, inline-block, and list-item.

property.description: Specifies how to display the element.
property.example:
For a demonstration of the display attribute and its values, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/display.html

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: inline
value.description: Display the element as one or more inline boxes.

value.name: block
value.description: Display the element as a block box.

value.name: inline-block
value.description: Display the element as an inline block box.

value.name: list-item
value.description: Display the element as a block box and inline list item box.

value.name: run-in
value.description: Display an element as a block or inline box, depending on the context.

value.name: compact
value.description: Display an element as a block or inline box, depending on the context.

value.name: marker
value.description: Specifies that generated content before or after a box is a marker.

value.name: inline-table
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table element.

value.name: table-row-group
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table row group.

value.name: table-header-group
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table header group.

value.name: table-footer-group
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table footer group.

value.name: table-row
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table row.

value.name: table-column-group
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table column group.

value.name: table-column
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table column.

value.name: table-cell
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table cell.

value.name: table-caption
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table caption.

value.name: table
value.description: Specifies that the element should be treated like a table.

value.name: none
value.description: Specifies that the element should generate no boxes.

property.name: dominant-baseline
property.description: Used to determine or re-determine a scaled-baseline-table

value.name: auto
value.description: If this property occurs on a block or inline-block element, then the user agent behavior depends on the value of the 'script' property.Otherwise, if this property occurs on an inline-level element, then the baseline-identifier and the baseline-table components remain the same as those of the parent element.

value.name: use-script
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier is set using the computed value of the 'script' property. The 'writing-mode' value, whether horizontal or vertical is used to select the baseline-table that correspond to that baseline-identifier. The baseline-table font-size component is set to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element.

value.name: no-change
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier, the baseline-table and the baseline-table font-size remain the same as that of the parent.

value.name: reset-size
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier and the baseline table remain the same, but the baseline-table font-size is changed to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element. This re-scales the baseline table for the current 'font-size'.

value.name: alphabetic
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to the 'alphabetic' baseline, the derived baseline-table is constructed using the 'alphabetic' baseline-table in the nominal font, and the baseline-table font-size is changed to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element.

value.name: hanging
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to the 'hanging' baseline, the derived baseline- table is constructed using the 'hanging' baseline-table in the nominal font, and the baseline-table font-size is changed to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element.

value.name: ideographic
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to the 'ideographic' baseline, the derived baseline- table is constructed using the 'ideographic' baseline-table in the nominal font, and the baseline-table font-size is changed to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element.

value.name: mathematical
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to the 'mathematical' baseline, the derived baseline- table is constructed using the 'mathematical' baseline-table in the nominal font, and the baseline-table font-size is changed to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element.

value.name: central
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to be 'central'. The derived baseline-table is constructed from the defined baselines in a baseline-table in the nominal font. That font baseline-table is chosen using the following priority order of baseline-table names: 'ideographic', 'alphabetic', 'hanging' and 'mathematical'. The baseline-table is changed to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element.

value.name: middle
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to be 'middle'. The derived baseline-table is constructed from the defined baselines in a baseline-table in the nominal font. That font baseline-table is chosen using the following priority order of baseline-table names: 'alphabetic', 'ideographic', 'hanging' and 'mathematical'. The baseline-table is changed to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element.

value.name: text-after-edge
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to be 'text-after-edge'. The derived baseline-table is constructed from the defined baselines in a baseline-table in the nominal font. That font baseline-table is chosen using the following priority order of baseline-table names: 'alphabetic', 'ideographic', 'hanging' and 'mathematical'. The baseline-table is changed to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element.

value.name: text-before-edge
value.description: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to be 'text-before-edge'. The derived baseline-table is constructed from the defined baselines in a baseline-table in the nominal font. That font baseline-table is chosen using the following priority order of baseline-table names: 'alphabetic', 'ideographic', 'hanging' and 'mathematical'. The baseline-table is changed to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element.

property.name: drop-initial-after-adjust
property.description: Sets the alignment point of the drop initial for the primary connection point.

value.name: before-edge
value.description: The alignment point is at the intersection of the end-edge of the element and the 'before-edge' of the extended inline box of the element. This may include or not the line-height of the element, depending on the line-stacking-strategy.

value.name: text-before-edge
value.description: The alignment point is at the intersection of the end-edge of the element and the 'text-before-edge' baseline of the element.

value.name: central
value.description: The alignment point is at the intersection of the end-edge of the element and the 'central' baseline of the element.

value.name: middle
value.description: The alignment point is at the intersection of the end-edge of the element and the 'middle' baseline of the element.

value.name: hanging
value.description: The alignment point is at the intersection of the end-edge of the element and the 'hanging' baseline of the element.

value.name: mathematical
value.description: The alignment point is at the intersection of the end-edge of the element and the 'mathematical' baseline of the element.

value.name: <percentage>
value.description: The computed value of the property is this percentage multiplied by the computed 'line-height' of the element. The alignment point is on the end-edge of the inline box and is offset from the text-before-edge by the computed value. A value of '0%' makes the text-before-edge the alignment point.

value.name: <length>
value.description: The alignment-point is on the end-edge of the inline box. Its position along the end-edge is offset from the text-before-edge by the 'length' value. A value of '0cm' makes the text-before-edge the alignment point.

property.name: drop-initial-after-align
property.description: Determines which alignment line within the nth line box (n being defined by the 'drop-initial-value' property) is used at the primary connection point with the initial letter box.

value.name: baseline
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the dominant baseline of the parent.

value.name: use-script
value.description: If the element 'script' property value is 'auto', the alignment point of each glyph is aligned with the baseline-identifier of the script to which the glyph belongs. If the element 'script' property value is other than 'auto', the alignment point of each glyph is aligned with the baseline-identifier specified by the 'script' property. The baseline-identifier position is determined by using the relevant information related to the parent element dominant-baseline set. The alignment point of the element itself is aligned as for the 'baseline' value.

value.name: before-edge
value.description: The alignment point of the box is aligned with the 'before-edge' baseline of the line box.

value.name: text-before-edge
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the 'text-before-edge' baseline of the parent.

value.name: after-edge
value.description: The alignment point of the box is aligned with the 'after-edge' baseline of the line box.

value.name: text-after-edge
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the 'text-after-edge' baseline of the parent.

value.name: central
value.description: The alignment point of the box is aligned with the 'central' baseline of the parent.

value.name: middle
value.description: The alignment point of the box is aligned with the 'middle' baseline of the parent.

value.name: ideographic
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the 'ideographic' baseline of the parent.

value.name: alphabetic
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the lower baseline of the parent.

value.name: hanging
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the hanging baseline of the parent.

value.name: mathematical
value.description: The alignment-point of the element being aligned is aligned with the mathematical baseline of the parent.

property.name: drop-initial-size
property.description: Controls the partial sinking of the initial letter. Using any other value than 'auto' removes the secondary connection line constraint.

value.name: auto
value.description: The drop initial letter is sized according to the constraints created by the the ink filling strategy and the two connection lines.

value.name: <line>
value.description: The drop initial letter is sized using the combined line height of the nth lines (as determined by the line value). The letter may be stretched on one dimension if the line height of each line is variable to avoid circular issues.

value.name: <length>
value.description: The drop initial letter is sized using the length value.

value.name: <percentage>
value.description: The drop initial letter is sized relatively to the combined line height of the n lines determined by the 'drop-initial-value' property value.

property.name: drop-initial-value
property.description: The basic property that activates a drop-initial effect. By providing a value different than 'initial or '1', the primary connection point is moved after the initial line.

value.name: initial
value.description: The drop initial letter is aligned on the initial line.

value.name: <integer>
value.description: The drop initial letter is sunken to the nth line (as determined by the integer value).

property.name: elevation
property.description: Specifies the elevation of the element. You can either one of the relative elevations or specify an angle in degrees.
property.remarks: To specify an angle, use syntax similar to "90deg".

value.description: Specify a value for elevation that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: below
value.description: Same as -90deg.

value.name: level
value.description: Same as 0deg.

value.name: above
value.description: Same as 90deg.

value.name: higher
value.description: Add 10deg to the current elevation.

value.name: lower
value.description: Subtract 10deg from the current elevation.

property.name: empty-cells
property.description: Specifies whether to show or hide borders for empty table cells.
property.example:
For a demonstration of the empty-cells attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/tables.html#emptycells

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: show
value.description: Display empty cells.

value.name: hide
value.description: Hide empty cells.

property.name: fit
property.description: Gives a hint for how to scale a replaced element if neither its 'width' nor its 'height' property is 'auto'. Not all replaced objects can be scaled, but images typically can.

value.name: fill
value.description: Scale the object's height and width independently so that the content just touches all edges of the containing box.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Do not scale the object.

value.name: meet
value.description: Make the object as large as possible with its width less than or equal to 'width' and height less than or equal to 'height', while preserving its aspect ratio. Position the object as for the 'hidden' value.

value.name: slice
value.description: Make the object as small as possible with its width greater than or equal to 'width' and height greater than or equal to 'height', while preserving its aspect ratio. Position the object as for the 'hidden' value.

property.name: fit-position
property.description: Specifies the poition of the fit element

property.name: filter
property.description: Specifies a filter for the element to render and any parameters that the filter takes. You can specify multiple filters.

property.name: float
property.description: Specifies if an element should float towards the left or right margin of its parent element or web browser.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: left
value.description: Float towards the left margin of the parent element.

value.name: right
value.description: Float towards the right margin of the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: No float.

property.name: fit-position
property.description: This property pushes floated elements in the opposite direction of the where they have been floated with float.

value.description: Specify a value for font-size that is not on this list.

value.description: X-large font.

property.description: Specifies the adjustment to make in font size if an explicitly specified font is unavailable.

property.description: Specifies how a font should be condensed or stretched.

value.description: Small capital letters. Not supported in Safari.

property.description: Specifies the weight of a font (e.g. bold).

property.name: hanging-punctuation
property.description: Determines whether a punctuation mark, if one is present, may be placed outside the line box at the start or at the end of a full line of text.

value.name: start
value.description: Punctuation may hang outside the start edge of the first line.

value.name: end
value.description: Punctuation may hang outside the end edge of the last line.

value.name: end-edge
value.description: Punctuation may hang outside the end edge of all lines.

property.name: height
property.description: Specifies the height (in pixels, points, or as a percentage) of the content of the element.
property.remarks: height does not include the margins, padding, or borders of an element.

value.description: Specify a value for height that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Height to be determined by the window or parent element.

property.name: hyphenate-after
property.description: Specifies the minimum number of characters in a hyphenated word after the hyphenation character.

property.name: hyphenate-before
property.description: Specifies the minimum number of characters in a hyphenated word before the hyphenation character.

property.name: hyphenate-before
property.description: Specifies a string that is shown when a hyphenate-break occurs. The auto value means that the User Agent should find an appropriate value.

property.name: hyphenate-lines
property.description: Indicates the maximum number of successive hyphenated lines in an element. In some cases, user agents may not be able to honor the specified value. The no-limit value means that there is no limit.

property.name: hyphenate-resource
property.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of external resources that can help the UA determine hyphenation points. If more than one resource is specified, the UA should consult each resource until it finds one that is able to determine hyphenation points in a word. The none value indicates that no external resources are available. In any case, the UA can also use local resources not listed on this property.

property.name: hyphens
property.description: Specifies a hyphens element

value.name: none
value.description: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest break points.

value.name: manual
value.description: Words are only broken at line breaks where there are characters inside the word that suggest line breaks.

value.name: auto
value.description: Words can be broken at appropriate hyphenation points, as determined by characters inside word, resources listed in hyphenate-resource, or other UA-dependent resources. Characters inside the word take priority over hyphenation points determined by other resources.

property.name: icon
property.description: Provides the author the ability to style any arbitrary element with an iconic equivalent. An element's icon is not used/rendered unless the 'content' property is set to the value 'icon' (see above). Documents whose elements have icons assigned to them can be more easily viewed by users who find too much text distracting.

value.name: auto
value.description: Use a default generic icon provided by the user agent.

value.name: <uri>
value.description: The 'uri' value(s) in this property refer to one or more icons in a comma delimited list. The user agent loads the referenced icons one by one until it finds one that it is able to render. This permits the usage of multiple different icon formats for various platforms, and various media for that matter.

property.name: image-orientation
property.description: Specifies a rotation in the right or clockwise direction that a user agent applies to an image. In terms of the order of transformations, the image is first rotated, then sized, then positioned. Thus height and width properties apply to the rotated rather than the original image dimensions.

value.name: auto
value.description: The image will be set to the orientation of the page. That is, for a pixelated image consisting of rows and columns of pixels, a row is displayed across the width of the display surface and a column along the height.

value.name: <angle>
value.description: A positive value rotates the image to the right (in a clockwise direction) by the given number of degrees. Negative values rotate to the left or in a counter-clockwise direction. Specified values outside the range of ]-360, 360[ degrees are moduloed by 360 to produce a computed value within that range. User agents MUST support values which compute to 0, 90, 180, and 270 degrees. Support for other values is optional.

property.name: image-resolution
property.description: Specifies the resolution of an image

value.name: normal
value.description: The resolution of the image is unknown, and UAs should not use the resolution found in the image. Instead, the image resolution will be found by making image pixels equivalent to CSS pixels.

value.name: auto
value.description: The UA must look for the resolution in the image itself. If the image has no image resolution, the next value in the comma-separated list is evaluated.

value.name: <dpi>
value.description: The value consists of a number with a dpi unit identifier. The UA should use the specified resolution.

property.name: ime-mode
property.description: Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for the element, which allows users to enter and edit Chinese, Japanese, and Korean characters.

value.name: auto
value.description: IME not affected.

value.name: active
value.description: Enter all characters through the IME.

value.name: inactive
value.description: Do not enter characters through the IME, although the IME is still active.

value.name: disabled
value.description: The IME is completely disabled.

property.name: inline-box-align
property.description: Determines which line of a multi-line inline block align with the previous and next inline elements within a line. The alignment strategy for the inline lock itself (i.e. the definition of it alignment point and which parent baseline should be used for the alignment) is determined by the inline block element baseline alignment properties applicable to the line being used for the alignment. This property has no effect for single line inline block.

value.name: initial
value.description: Use the initial line of the inline block element for alignment purpose.

value.name: last
value.description: Use the last line of the inline block element for alignment purpose.

value.name: <integer>
value.description: Use nth line (as determined by the integer value) of the inline block element for alignment purpose.

property.name: layout-flow
property.description: Specifies the flow direction for the content of the element.

value.name: horizontal
value.description: Content flows from left to right.

value.name: vertical-ideographic
value.description: Content flows from top to bottom.

property.name: layout-grid
property.description: Defines the set of layout-grid properties for an element.

value.name: horizontal
value.description: Content flows from left to right.

value.name: vertical-ideographic
value.description: Content flows from top to bottom.

property.name: layout-grid-char
property.description: Specifies the size of a character grid for the content of an element.

value.description: Specify a value for layout-grid-char that is not on this list.

value.name: auto
value.description: Largest character in the font for the element content sets the grid size.

value.name: none
value.description: Character grid size is not set.

property.name: layout-grid-line
property.description: Specifies the grid line value for the text content of an element.

value.description: Specify a value for layout-grid-char that is not on this list.

value.name: auto
value.description: Largest character in the font for the element content sets the grid line.

value.name: none
value.description: Character grid line is not set.

property.name: layout-grid-mode
property.description: Specifies if the element text layout grid uses the line and/or char mode.

value.name: both
value.description: Use both the line and char mode.

value.name: none
value.description: Do not use a grid.

value.name: line
value.description: Use a line grid. (Recommended for inline elements.)

value.name: char
value.description: Use a character grid. (Recommended for block elements.)

property.name: layout-grid-type
property.description: Specifies the type of layout grid for the content of an element.

value.name: loose
value.description: Use for Japanese and Korean characters.

value.name: strict
value.description: Use for Japanese (Genko), Chinese, and Korean characters.

value.name: fixed
value.description: Use for monospace layouts.

property.name: left
property.description: Specifies the x-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the left edge of the parent element or browser window.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for left.

value.description: Specify a value for left that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Left edge position to be determined by the window or parent element.

property.name: letter-spacing
property.description: Specifies the amount of space (in points or pixels) between letters in the text of the element.

value.description: Specify a value for letter-spacing that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: normal
value.description: Normal letter spacing.

property.name: line-break
property.description: Specifies line-breaking rules for Japanese text.

value.name: normal
value.description: Normal line-breaking rules.

value.name: strict
value.description: Strict line-breaking rules.

property.name: line-height
property.description: Specifies line height of text in multiline elements, such as paragraphs.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for line-height.

value.description: Specify a value for line-height that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: normal
value.description: Normal line-height.

property.name: line-stacking
property.description: Specifies a shorthand for line-stacking.

property.name: line-stacking-ruby
property.description: Determines the line stacking method for block elements containing ruby annotation elements (element with 'display: ruby-text' or 'display: ruby-text-container'). In all cases the ruby base elements (elements with 'display: ruby-base' or display: ruby-base-container') are considered for line stacking.

value.name: exclude-ruby
value.description: The ruby annotation elements are ignored for line stacking.

value.name: include-ruby
value.description: The ruby annotation elements are considered for line stacking.

property.name: line-stacking-shift
property.description: Determines the line stacking method for block elements containing elements with base-shift.

value.name: consider-shifts
value.description: In determining the stack-height, include the adjusted top-edge and bottom-edge of any characters that have a baseline-shift.

value.name: disregard-shifts
value.description: In determining the stack-height, include the unshifted top-edge and bottom-edge of any characters that have a baseline-shift.

property.name: line-stacking-strategy
property.description: Determines the line stacking strategy for stacked line boxes within a containing block element. The term 'stack-height' is used in the context of this property description to indicate the block-progression advance for the line boxes.

value.name: inline-line-height
value.description: The stack-height is the smallest value that contains the extended block progression dimension of all the inline elements on that line when those elements are properly aligned. Since the line spacing information is already included in the computation of the line box, these line boxes are simply stacked adjacent to one another in the formatted block to which they belong. The 'line-height' property value is taken into account for both the inline elements and the block elements.

value.name: block-line-height
value.description: The stack-height is determined by the block element 'line-height' property value. The 'line-height' property value is ignored for inline elements. For alignment purpose, this case is similar to the minimum extended block progression dimension case (strut model). This is the only line-stacking strategy that may cause inline boxes within the line to bleed before and after the line box because the line box is not constrained by its inline boxes.

value.name: max-height
value.description: The stack-height is the smallest value that contains the block progression dimension of all the inline elements on that line when those elements are properly aligned. The 'line-height' property value is taken into account only for the block elements.

value.name: grid-height
value.description: The stack-height is the smallest multiple of the block element 'line-height' computed value that can contain the block progression of all the inline elements on that line when those elements are properly aligned. The 'line-height' property value is ignored for inline elements.

property.name: list-style

browser.description: Browser support incomplete in IE 5, 6, and 7.

property.name: margin
property.description: Defines the widths (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the margins for the element.
property.example: To specify a margin that is 10px wide on the top and left and 5px wide on the bottom and right, use the following syntax: body {margin: 10px 5px 5px 10px;}.
property.remarks:
Use the margin property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual margin properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a margin property as part of margin.

You can specify up to four different widths for the margin of an element.

  • For a margin that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For a margin that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For a margin that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For a margin with four different widths, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.

property.name: margin-bottom
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the bottom margin of an element.

property.name: margin-left
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the left margin of an element.

property.name: margin-right
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the right margin of an element.

property.name: margin-top
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the top margin of an element.

property.name: mark
property.description: Specifies a shorthand for setting 'mark-before' and 'mark-after'. If two values are given the first value is 'mark-before' and the second is 'mark-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

property.name: mark-after
property.description: Allow named markers to be attached after audio stream

property.name: mark-before
property.description: Allow named markers to be attached before audio stream

property.name: marker-offset
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels or points) between the marker box of an element and the surrounding box of its parent element.

property.name: marks
property.description: Specifies if cross or crop marks should appear outside of the element on a printed page.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: crop
value.description: Display crop marks (for cutting the page).

value.name: cross
value.description: Display cross marks (for aligning the page).

value.name: none
value.description: Display no marks.

property.name: marquee-direction
property.description: Determines the initial direction in which the content moves if the marquee effect is used. Forward moves the text so that hidden text appears in the normal reading order, reverse does the opposite.

value.name: forward
value.description: Moves text forward

value.name: reverse
value.description: Moves text backwards

property.name: marquee-play-count
property.description: Specifies how many times the content moves. UAs should restart the loop count every time the element turns from completely invisible into (fully or partially) visible. E.g., an element that is outside the viewport starts moving when it is scrolled into view.

property.name: marquee-speed
property.description: Determines how fast the content scrolls. The actual speed depends on the UA and the type of content.

value.name: slow
value.description: Sets content scroll speed to slow

value.name: normal
value.description: Sets content scroll speed to normal

value.name: fast
value.description: Sets content scroll speed to fast

property.name: marquee-style
property.description: Determines the style of content scrolls.

value.name: scroll
value.description: Start completely off one side, scroll all the way across and completely off.

value.name: slide
value.description: Start completely off one side, scroll in, and stop as soon as no more content is off that side.

value.name: alternate
value.description: Bounce back and forth.

property.name: move-to
property.description: Causes the element or pseudo-element to be removed from the flow and reinserted at a later point in the document. The content is reinserted using the 'pending()' value of the 'content' property.

value.name: here
value.description: The element or pseudo-element is not moved. This value inhibits the creation of '::alternate' pseudo-elements and any pseudo-elements that have such a pseudo-element as a superior.

value.name: <identifier>
value.description: The element is not displayed at the current location, but at the next occurrence of 'pending(identifier)' (where the identifiers match), with all other elements moved to that point, in document order. If at the end af the document (after the '::after' pseudo-elements of the root element) there are outstanding elements, then they are all inserted in document order at that point.

property.name: nav-down
property.description: Specifies the position of the current element in the sequential navigation order for the current document.

value.name: auto
value.description: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

value.name: <id>
value.description: The 'id' value consists of a '#' character followed by an identifier, similar to a fragment identifier in a URL. It indicates the element to which the focus is navigated to in response to directional navigation input respective to the specific property.

value.name: <target-name>
value.description: The 'target-name' parameter indicates the target frame for the focus navigation. It is a string and it cannot start with the underscore '_' character. If the specified target frame does not exist, the parameter will be treated as the keyword 'current', which means to simply use the frame that the element is in.

property.name: nav-index
property.description: Specifies an input-method-neutral way of specifying the sequential navigation order.

value.name: auto
value.description: The element's sequential navigation order is assigned automatically by the user agent.

value.name: <number>
value.description: The number (which is non-zero and positive) indicates the sequential navigation order for the element. '1' means first. Elements with the same nav-index value are navigated in document order when that nav-index value is being navigated.

property.name: nav-left
property.description: Specifies the position of the current element in the sequential navigation order for the current document.
