property.name: overflow

browser.description: Support for overflow is almost complete for IE 5-6
Support for overflow is not dynamic.

property.description: Specifies how to handle content overflow of an element if the content does not fit within the predefined boundaries of the element.
property.example:
For a demonstration of the overflow attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/overflow.html

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: visible
value.description: Content is rendered outside of the element.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Content is clipped at the boundaries of the element.

value.name: scroll
value.description: Display scroll bars to access overflow content.

value.name: auto
value.description: Overflow behavior to be determined by the window or user settings.

property.name: overflow-style
property.description: Specifies the preferred scrolling method for elements that overflow (see the overflow property.) If the UA does not support the specified value, it must act as if the value was auto.

value.name: auto
value.description: The UA chooses the scrolling mechanism. Marquees and scrollbars are common mechanisms, but the UA may also use others.

value.name: marquee-line
value.description: This selects marquee as the horizontal scrolling mechanism (i.e., for content that overflows to the left or right). The scrolling mechanism in the perpendicular direction is left to the UA, but should not be marquee.

value.name: marquee-block
value.description: This selects marquee as the vertical scrolling mechanism (i.e., for content that overflows above or below the box). The scrolling mechanism in the perpendicular direction is left to the UA, but should not be marquee.

property.name: overflow-x
property.description: Specifies how to handle content overflow of an element if the content is too wide for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: visible
value.description: Content is rendered outside of the element.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Content is clipped at the boundaries of the element.

value.name: scroll
value.description: Display scroll bars to access overflow content.

value.name: auto
value.description: Overflow behavior to be determined by the window or user settings.

property.name: overflow-y
property.description: Specifies how to handle content overflow of an element if the content is too tall for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: visible
value.description: Content is rendered outside of the element.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Content is clipped at the boundaries of the element.

value.name: scroll
value.description: Display scroll bars to access overflow content.

value.name: auto
value.description: Overflow behavior to be determined by the window or user settings.

property.name: padding
property.description: Specifies the amount of padding space between the content of an element and its border.
property.example: To specify a padding that is 10px wide on the top and left and 5px wide on the bottom and right, use the following syntax: body {padding: 10px 5px 5px 10px;}.
property.remarks:
Use the padding property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual padding properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a padding property as part of padding.

You can specify up to four different widths for the amound of padding for an element.

  • For padding that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For padding that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For padding that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For padding with four different widths, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.

property.name: padding-bottom
property.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) at the bottom of an element.

property.name: padding-left
property.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the left side of an element.

property.name: padding-right
property.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the right side of an element.

property.name: padding-top
property.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) at the top of an element.

property.name: page
property.description: Specifies the type of page that the element should be displayed on.

property.name: page-break-after
property.description: Defines the way that a page breaks after the element when the page is printed.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Page break behavior to be determined by the user or window settings.

value.name: always
value.description: Always insert a page break after the element.

value.name: avoid
value.description: Avoid a page break after the element.

value.name: left
value.description: Page break to a left page (e.g. like in a book) after the element.

value.name: right
value.description: Page break to a right page (e.g. like in a book) after the element.

property.name: page-break-before
property.description: Defines the way that a page breaks before the element when the page is printed.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Page break behavior to be determined by the user or window settings.

value.name: always
value.description: Always insert a page break before the element.

value.name: avoid
value.description: Avoid a page break before the element.

value.name: left
value.description: Page break to a left page (e.g. like in a book) before the element.

value.name: right
value.description: Page break to a right page (e.g. like in a book) before the element.

property.name: page-break-inside
property.description: Specifies if an element should have a page break forced inside of the element or if page breaks should be avoided inside the element when the page is printed.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: avoid
value.description: Avoid a page break inside the element.

value.name: always
value.description: Always insert a page break inside the element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Page break behavior to be determined by the user or window settings.

property.name: page-policy
property.description: Determines which page-based occurance of a given element is applied to a counter or string value.

value.name: start
value.description: Takes the value of the counter or string at the beginning of the page (before applying style to the elements of the page, but after applying it to the @page context itself).

value.name: first
value.description: Takes the value after the first state change in the counter or string during processing of the page.

value.name: last
value.description: Takes the value following the final state change on the page.

property.name: pause
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds or milliseconds to pause before and/or after an element before playing audio content.
property.remarks: Use the pause property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual pause properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a pause property as part of pause.

property.name: pause-after
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds or milliseconds to pause after an element before playing audio content.

property.name: pause-before
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds or milliseconds to pause before an element before playing audio content.

property.name: perspective
property.description: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

property.name: perspective-origin
property.description: Establishes the origin for the perspective property

property.name: phonemes
property.description: Allows authors to specify a phonetic pronunciation for the text contained by the corresponding element.

property.name: pitch
property.description: Specifies the frequency of a speaking voice for audio content.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: x-low
value.description: Extra-low frequency.

value.name: low
value.description: Low frequency.

value.name: medium
value.description: Medium frequency.

value.name: high
value.description: High frequency.

value.name: x-high
value.description: Extra-high frequency.

property.name: pitch-range
property.description: Specifies the range of the pitch of a speaking voice for audio content.

property.name: play-during
property.description: Specifies a sound to play while the content of the element is being spoken.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: mix
value.description: Mix the sound from the element with the sound from the parent element.

value.name: repeat
value.description: Repeat the sound.

value.name: auto
value.description: Continue to play the sound of the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: No sound.

property.name: position

browser.description: IE 6 does not support position:fixed.

property.description: Specifies how the element is positioned relative to the page or other elements.
property.example:
For a demonstration of the position attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/position.html

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: static
value.description: Position the element in the order that it occurs in the document.

value.name: relative
value.description: Position the element with offsets relative to the document flow.

value.name: absolute
value.description: Position the element at the specified coordinates.

value.name: fixed
value.description: Position the element in a fixed position as the page scrolls.

property.name: presentation-level
property.description: Sets the element's presentation level

value.name: same
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: increment
value.description: Computes to a value one more than the previous (in document order) element's presentation level.

value.name: <integer>
value.description: Computes to the same value as the previous element's (in document order) presentation level. For the root element, 'same' computes to zero.

property.name: punctuation-trim
property.description: Determines whether or not a fullwidth punctuation character should be trimmed (kerned) if it appears at the start or end of a line, or adjacent to another fullwidth punctuation character.

value.name: none
value.description: Do not trim or kern the blank half of fullwidth opening or closing punctuation glyphs.

value.name: start
value.description: Trim (kern) the blank half of fullwidth opening punctuation at the beginning of each line.

value.name: end
value.description: Trim (kern) the blank half of fullwidth closing punctuation at the end of each line.

value.name: adjacent
value.description: Trim (kern) the blank half of fullwidth opening punctuation if its previous adjacent character is a fullwidth opening punctuation, fullwidth middle dot punctuation, fullwidth closing punctuation, or ideographic space (U+3000). Trim (kern) the blank half of fullwidth closing punctuation if its next adjacent character is a fullwidth closing punctuation, fullwidth middle dot punctuation, or ideographic space (U+3000).

property.name: quotes
property.description: Specifies the style of quotation marks to use for embedded quotes.

property.name: rendering-intent
property.description: Permits the specification of a color profile rendering intent other than the default.
property.hint: auto | perceptual | relative-colorimetric | saturation | absolute-colorimetric | inherit

property.name: resize
property.description: Allows the author to specify whether or not an element is resizable by the user, and if so, along which axis/axes.

value.name: none
value.description: The UA does not present a resizing mechanism on the element, and the user is given no direct manipulation mechanism to resize the element.

value.name: both
value.description: The UA presents a bidirectional resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust both the height and the width of the element.

value.name: horizontal
value.description: The UA presents a unidirectional horizontal resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust only the width of the element.

value.name: vertical
value.description: The UA presents a unidirectional vertical resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust only the height of the element.

property.name: rest
property.description: Specifies a shorthand for setting 'rest-before' and 'rest-after'. If two values are given, the first value is 'rest-before' and the second is 'rest-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

property.name: rest-after
property.description: These properties specify a rest or prosodic boundary to be observed after speaking an element's content.

value.name: <length>
value.description: Expresses the rest in absolute time units (seconds and milliseconds, e.g. '3s', '250ms'). Only positive values are allowed.

value.name: none
value.description: No prosodic break boundary should be output

value.name: x-weak
value.description: Set prosodic strength of the break in speech output to x-weak

value.name: weak
value.description: Set prosodic strength of the break in speech output to weak

value.name: medium
value.description: Set prosodic strength of the break in speech output to medium

value.name: strong
value.description: Set prosodic strength of the break in speech output to strong

value.name: x-strong
value.description: Set prosodic strength of the break in speech output to x-strong

property.name: rest-before
property.description: These properties specify a rest or prosodic boundary to be observed before speaking an element's content.

value.name: <length>
value.description: Expresses the rest in absolute time units (seconds and milliseconds, e.g. '3s', '250ms'). Only positive values are allowed.

value.name: none
value.description: No prosodic break boundary should be output

value.name: x-weak
value.description: Set prosodic strength of the break in speech output to x-weak

value.name: weak
value.description: Set prosodic strength of the break in speech output to weak

value.name: medium
value.description: Set prosodic strength of the break in speech output to medium

value.name: strong
value.description: Set prosodic strength of the break in speech output to strong

value.name: x-strong
value.description: Set prosodic strength of the break in speech output to x-strong

property.name: richness
property.description: Specifies the richness of the speaking voice for audio content.

property.name: right
property.description: Specifies the x-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the right edge of the parent element or browser window.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for right.

value.description: Specify a value for right that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Right edge of the element should be determined by the window or parent element.

property.name: rotation
property.description: Specifies the rotation of an element

property.name: rotation-point
property.description: Specifies a pair of values that defines a point as an offset from the top left border edge. Percentages refer to the width and height of the border box.

property.name: ruby-align
property.description: Specifies the alignment for ruby text.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Alignment determined by browser.

value.name: left
value.description: Ruby text is left-aligned with base.

value.name: center
value.description: Ruby text is center-aligned with base.

value.name: right
value.description: Ruby text is right-aligned with base.

value.name: distribute-letter
value.description: Distribute evenly based on the letters of ruby text content.

value.name: distribute-space
value.description: Distrute evenly based on the space of the ruby text content.

value.name: line-edge
value.description: Center ruby text if it is not adjacent to a line edge.

property.name: ruby-overhang
property.description: Specifies the overhang of ruby text.

value.name: auto
value.description: Ruby text overhangs any text adjacent to the base text.

value.name: whitespace
value.description: Ruby text only overhangs whitespace characters.

value.name: none
value.description: Ruby text only overhangs text adjacent to its base.

property.name: ruby-position
property.description: Specifies the position of ruby text.

value.name: above
value.description: Ruby text is positioned above the base text.

value.name: inline
value.description: Ruby text is positioned inline with the base text.

property.name: ruby-span
property.description: Controls the spanning behavior of annotation elements.

value.name: attr(x)
value.description: The value of attribute 'x' as a string value. The string value is evaluated as a 'number' to determine the number of ruby base elements to be spanned by the annotation element. If the 'number' is '0', it is replaced by '1'.The 'number' is the computed value.

value.name: none
value.description: No spanning. The computed value is '1'.

property.name: scrollbar-3dlight-color
property.description: Specifies the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: scrollbar-arrow-color
property.description: Specifies the color of the arrow of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: scrollbar-base-color
property.description: Specifies the color of the main elements of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: scrollbar-darkshadow-color
property.description: Specifies the color of the gutter of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: scrollbar-face-color
property.description: Specifies the color of the scroll box and arrows of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: scrollbar-highlight-color
property.description: Specifies the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and arrows of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: scrollbar-shadow-color
property.description: Specifies the color of the bottom and right edges of the scroll box and arrows of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: scrollbar-track-color
property.description: Specifies the color of the track element of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: size
property.description: Specifies the size and orientation of a page for print output.
property.example: To specify an 10x8 inch page that prints as landscape, use the following syntax: body {size: landscape 10in 8in;}.
property.hint: [width] [height] [size-value]. Example values: 8.5in 10in portrait, 14 in 10 in, landscape, etc.

value.description: Specify a value for size that is not on this list.

value.name: auto
value.description: Page size to be determined by window or user settings.

value.name: portrait
value.description: Portrait layout on the page.

value.name: landscape
value.description: Landscape layout on the page.

property.name: speak
property.description: Specifies how the content will be rendered as audio content.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: normal
value.description: Render the content according to its language.

value.name: none
value.description: No audio.

value.name: spell-out
value.description: Spell out each letter of the text for the content.

property.name: speak-header
property.description: For audio content, specifies whether table headers are spoken before every cell or just once until the header changes.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: once
value.description: Speak the name of the header once.

value.name: always
value.description: Speak the name of the header before each associated cell.

property.name: speak-numeral
property.description: For audio content, specifies whether numerals are spoken as individual digits or continuous numbers.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: digits
value.description: Speak the digits of a number individually (e.g. 'one-three').

value.name: continuous
value.description: Speak the digits as a continuous number (e.g. 'thirteen').

property.name: speak-punctuation
property.description: For audio content, specifies whether punctuation characters will be spoken or read as pauses.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: code
value.description: Speak the name of each punction mark (e.g. Say the word, 'period' at the end of a sentence.

value.name: none
value.description: Render punctuation as pauses.

property.name: speech-rate
property.description: For audio content, specifies the speaking rate.

value.description: Specify a value for speech-rate that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: x-slow
value.description: Speak extra-slowly.

value.name: slow
value.description: Speak slowly.

value.name: medium
value.description: Speak at a normal rate.

value.name: fast
value.description: Speak quickly.

value.name: x-fast
value.description: Speak extra-quickly.

value.name: faster
value.description: Speak faster.

value.name: slower
value.description: Speak slower.

property.name: stress
property.description: For audio content, specifies the number of inflection points in the voice.

property.name: string-set
property.description: Accepts a comma-separated list of named strings. Each named string is followed by a content list that specifies which text to copy into the named string. Whenever an element with value of string-set different from none is encountered, the named strings are assigned their respective value.

property.name: table-layout

browser.description: table-layout is not supported in IE on a Mac.

property.description: Specifies whether the layout of table rows, columns, and cells is fixed.
property.example:
For a demonstration of the table-layout attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/tables.html#tablelayout

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Use the standard table layout rendering.

value.name: fixed
value.description: Render the table layout in a single pass.

property.name: target
property.description: Specifies a shorthand property for setting the individual target properties (i.e., 'target-name', 'target-new' and 'target-position') at the same place in the style sheet. Given a valid declaration, the 'target' property first sets all the individual target properties to their initial values, then assigns explicit values given in the declaration.

property.name: target-name
property.description: Defines the name of the target destination, including a few keywords for well known destinations.

value.name: current
value.description: The name of the current frame, tab or window where the link resides. This value never causes a new destination to be created.

value.name: root
value.description: The name of the current tab (if there is one) or window. This value never causes a new destination to be created.

value.name: parent
value.description: The name of the parent of the current frame. If the current frame has no parent this value is treated as 'root'. This value never causes a new destination to be created.

value.name: new
value.description: A new destination (see 'target-new') is always created.

value.name: modal
value.description: A new modal window is temporarily created.

value.name: <string>
value.description: The target is displayed in the existing frame, window or tab of that name. If no such named destination exists, a new destination (see 'target-new') is created with that name.

property.name: target-new
property.description: Determines what new target destination (if any) is created.

value.name: window
value.description: The target is displayed in a new window.

value.name: tab
value.description: The target is displayed in a new tab of an existing window.

value.name: none
value.description: No new destination is created. The target is not displayed.

property.name: target-position
property.description: Indicates where a new destination (if any) is created.

value.name: above
value.description: The new destination tab (window) is placed above the current tab (window) respectively.

value.name: behind
value.description: The new destination tab (window) is placed behind the current tab (window) respectively.

value.name: front
value.description: The new destination tab (window) is placed above all other tabs (windows) respectively.

value.name: back
value.description: The new destination tab (window) is placed behind all other tabs (windows) respectively.

property.name: text-align
property.description: Specifies the horizontal alignment property for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: left
value.description: Align the text at the left edge.

value.name: right
value.description: Align the text at the right edge.

value.name: center
value.description: Align the text at the center of the element.

value.name: justify
value.description: Justify the text alignment.

property.name: text-align-last
property.description: Specifies the alignment for the last or only line of text for the element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Align text according to text-align.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: left
value.description: Align the text at the left edge.

value.name: right
value.description: Align the text at the right edge.

value.name: center
value.description: Align the text at the center of the element.

value.name: justify
value.description: Justify the text alignment.

property.name: text-decoration
property.description: Specifies a text decoration for the element.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: none
value.description: No text decoration.

value.name: underline
value.description: Underline the text.

value.name: overline
value.description: Draw a line over the text.

value.name: line-through
value.description: Draw a line through the text (i.e. strikethrough).

value.name: blink
value.description: Text should blink.

property.name: text-emphasis
property.description: Applies emphasis formatting applied to text. Unlike 'text-decoration', emphasis marks can affect the line height.

value.name: none
value.description: No emphasis marks.

value.name: accent
value.description: Draw calligraphic accent strokes as marks.

value.name: dot
value.description: Draw calligraphic dots as marks.

value.name: circle
value.description: Draw hollow circles as marks.

value.name: disc
value.description: Draw filled circles as marks.

value.name: before
value.description: Draw marks above the text in horizontal layout, to the right in vertical layout. This is the default position.

value.name: after
value.description: Draw marks below the text in horizontal layout, to the left in vertical layout.

property.name: text-height
property.description: Determines the block-progression dimension of the text content area of an inline box.

value.name: auto
value.description: The block-progression dimension is based either on the em square determined by the element font-size property value or the cell-height (ascender + descender) related to the element font-size as chosen by the user agent.

value.name: font-size
value.description: The block-progression dimension is based on the em square as determined by the element font-size.

value.name: text-size
value.description: The block-progression dimension is based on the cell-height (ascender + descender) related to the element font-size.

value.name: max-size
value.description: The block-progression dimension is based on the maximum extents toward the before-edge and after-edge of the box obtained by considering all children elements located on the same line, ruby annotations (elements with 'display:ruby-text') and baseline shifted elements.

property.name: text-indent
property.description: Specifies the amount (in pixels, points, or a percentage) that the first line of text should be indented in a block of content.

property.name: text-justify
property.description: Specifies the alignment to use to justify the text for the element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Use browser justification.

value.name: distribute
value.description: Increases or decreases letter spacing between words. Optomized for Asian languages.

value.name: distribute-all-lines
value.description: Same as distribute, but also justifies last line in a paragraph.

value.name: distribute-center-last
value.description: Not implemented.

value.name: inter-cluster
value.description: Justifies lines of text with no inter-word spacing.

value.name: inter-ideograph
value.description: Justifies lines of ideograph text, including both inter-ideograph and inter-word spacing.

value.name: inter-word
value.description: Justifies lines of text based on spacing between words.

value.name: kashida
value.description: Justifies lines of text by elongating characters.

value.name: newspaper
value.description: Increases or decreases letter spacing between words.

property.name: text-outline
property.description: Specifies a text outline where the first length represents the outline's thickness and the second represents an optional blur radius.

property.name: text-replace
property.description: Replaces all occurrences of a certain string with another string in the content of the element.The property accepts pairs of strings as value, in addition to the initial none value. For each pair of strings, occurrences of the first string in the content will be replaced with the second string. If none is specified, no replacements will occur.

property.name: text-overflow
property.description: Specifies whether to use ellipses (...) to indicate text overflow.

value.name: ellipsis
value.description: Use ellipses (...) for text overflow.

value.name: clip
value.description: Clip content for overflow text.

property.name: text-shadow
property.description: Defines the horizontal depth, vertical depth, blur, and color for a drop-shadow for text content in the element.
property.example: To specify a blue 5 pixel drop-shadow with a 5 pixel blur, use the following syntax: H1 {text-shadow: 5px 5px 5px blue;}.
property.remarks: Specify the color before or after the depth and blur values. The first depth value corresponds to the number of pixels the shandow extends to the right. The second depth value corresponds to the number of pixels the shadow extends below the text. A third value corresponds to blur.

property.name: text-transform
property.description: Specifies that the text for the element should be converted to the assigned case or format.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: capitalize
value.description: Capitalize the first letter of every word.

value.name: uppercase
value.description: Capitalize every letter of every word.

value.name: lowercase
value.description: Convert all letters to lowercase.

value.name: none
value.description: Override any inherited text-transform values.

property.name: text-underline-position
property.description: Specifies the position of the underline text-decoration.

value.name: above
value.description: Underline appears above the text.

value.name: below
value.description: Underline appears below the text.

value.name: auto
value.description: Underline appears in the appropriate position for the language of the element.

value.name: auto-pos
value.description: Same as auto.

property.name: text-wrap
property.description: Specifies the mode for text wrapping.

value.name: capitalize
value.description: Lines may break at allowed break points, as determined by the line-breaking rules in effect. Line breaking behavior defined for the WJ, ZW, and GL line-breaking classes in [UAX14] must be honored.

value.name: uppercase
value.description: Lines may not break; text that does not fit within the block box overflows it.

value.name: lowercase
value.description: Lines may break between any two grapheme clusters. Line-breaking restrictions have no effect and hyphenation does not take place. Character shaping is performed on each side of the break as if the break had not occurred.

value.name: none
value.description: Line breaking is suppressed within the element: the UA may only break within the element if there are no other valid break points in the line. If the text breaks, line-breaking restrictions are honored as for 'normal'.

property.name: top
property.description: Specifies the y-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the top edge of the parent element or browser window.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for top.

value.description: Specify a value for top that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Top position to be determined by the window or parent element.

property.name: transform
property.description: Used to apply a 2D or 3D transformation to an element.

property.name: transform-origin
property.description: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

property.name: transform-style
property.description: Defines how nested elements are rendered in 3D space.

property.name: transition
property.description: Specifies a shorthand property combines the four properties of transition into a single property.

property.name: transition-delay
property.description: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

property.name: transition-duration
property.description: Defines the length of time that a transition takes.

property.name: transition-property
property.description: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

property.name: transition-timing-function
property.description: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

value.name: ease
value.description: The ease function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0).

value.name: linear
value.description: The linear function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in
value.description: The ease-in function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 1.0, 1.0).

value.name: ease-out
value.description: The ease-out function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.58, 1.0).

value.name: ease-in-out
value.description: The ease-in-out function is equivalent to cubic-bezier(0.42, 0, 0.58, 1.0)

value.name: cubic-bezier
value.description: Specifies a cubic-bezier curve.

property.name: unicode-bidi
property.description: Specifies that the text direction in the element may be overriden for multi-language support.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: normal
value.description: Standard direction and rendering.

value.name: embed
value.description: A new level of embedding may change direction.

value.name: bidi-override
value.description: The direction property may override a pre-defined direction.

property.name: vertical-align
property.description: Specifies the vertical alignment property for the element.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for vertical-align.

value.description: Specify a value for vertical-align that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: bottom
value.description: Align the bottom of the aligned subtree with the bottom of the line box.

value.name: baseline
value.description: Align with the baseline of the containing element.

value.name: sub
value.description: Align as subscript.

value.name: super
value.description: Align as superscript.

value.name: top
value.description: Align with the top of the tallest element.

value.name: text-top
value.description: Align with the top of the text of the containing element.

value.name: middle
value.description: Align with the middle of the containing element.

value.name: text-bottom
value.description: Align with the bottom of the text of the containing element.

property.name: visibility

browser.description: Supports only the "hidden" for table columns.
Supports only the "collapse" for table columns.

property.description: Specifies whether an element is visible or hidden.
property.example:
For additional information and a demonstration of the visibility attribute for table columns, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/columns.html#visibility
property.remarks: The visibility attribute is not well-supported for table columns in some browsers.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: visible
value.description: Element is visible.

value.name: hidden
value.description: Element is hidden.

value.name: collapse
value.description: Element is collapsed (e.g. table cells).

property.name: voice-balance
property.description: Refers to the balance between left and right channels, and presumes a two channel (stereo) model that is widely supported on consumer audio equipment.

value.name: <length>
value.description: An integer or floating point number between '-100' and '100'. For '-100' only the left channel is audible. Simarly for '100' or '+100' only the right channel is audible. For '0' both channels have the same level, so that the speech appears to be coming from the center.

value.name: left
value.description: Same as '-100'.

value.name: center
value.description: Same as '0'.

value.name: right
value.description: Same as '100' or '+100'.

value.name: leftwards
value.description: Moves the sound to the left, relative to the inherited voice balance. More precisely, subtract 20 from the inherited value and clip the resulting value to the range '-100' and '100'.

value.name: rightwards
value.description: Moves the sound to the right, relative to the inherited voice balance. More precisely, add 20 to the inherited value and clip the resulting value to the range '-100' and '100'.

property.name: voice-duration
property.description: Specifies how long it should take to render the selected element's content. This property overrides the 'voice-rate' property.

value.name: <time>
value.description: Specifies a value in seconds or milliseconds for the desired time to take to speak the element contents, for instance, '250ms', or '3s'. Only positive numbers are allowed.

property.name: voice-family
property.description: Specifies the speaking voice for audio content.
property.hint: [voice-name | voice-family-value]. Example values: george, robot, male, etc.
property.remarks: You can specify a specific voice name and/or a male, female, or child voice.

value.description: Specify a specific voice name not on this list.

value.name: male
value.description: Male-sounding voice.

value.name: female
value.description: Female-sounding voice.

value.name: child
value.description: Voice of a child.

property.name: voice-pitch
property.description: Specifies the average pitch (a frequency) of the speaking voice. The average pitch of a voice depends on the voice family. For example, the average pitch for a standard male voice is around 120Hz, but for a female voice, it's around 210Hz.

value.name: <number>
value.description: A positive integer or floating point number that specifies the average pitch of the speaking voice in Hertz.

value.name: <percentage>
value.description: Specifies a relative change to the inherited value.

value.name: x-low
value.description: Sets voice pitch to x-low.

value.name: low
value.description: Sets voice pitch to low.

value.name: medium
value.description: Sets voice pitch to medium.

value.name: high
value.description: Sets voice pitch to high.

value.name: x-high
value.description: Sets voice pitch to x-high.

property.name: voice-pitch-range
property.description: Specifies variation in average pitch.

value.name: <number>
value.description: An non-negative integer or floating point number indicating pitch range in Hertz. Low ranges produce a flat, monotonic voice. A high range produces animated voices.

value.name: <percentage>
value.description: Specifies a relative change to the inherited value.

value.name: x-low
value.description: Sets voice pitch range to x-low.

value.name: low
value.description: Sets voice pitch range to low.

value.name: medium
value.description: Sets voice pitch range to medium.

value.name: high
value.description: Sets voice pitch range to high.

value.name: x-high
value.description: Sets voice pitch range to x-high.

property.name: voice-rate
property.description: Controls the speaking rate. The default rate for a voice depends on the language and dialect and on the personality of the voice. The default rate for a voice should be such that it is experienced as a normal speaking rate for the voice when reading aloud text.

value.name: <percentage>
value.description: Applies to the default speaking rate for each voice. Thus 50% means half the normal rate for this voice.

value.name: x-slow
value.description: Sets voice rate to x-slow.

value.name: slow
value.description: Sets voice rate to slow.

value.name: medium
value.description: Sets voice rate to medium.

value.name: fast
value.description: Sets voice rate to fast.

value.name: x-fast
value.description: Sets voice rate to x-fast.

property.name: voice-stress
property.description: Indicates the strength of emphasis to be applied. Emphasis is indicated using a combination of pitch change, timing changes, loudness and other acoustic differences) that varies from one language to the next.

value.name: none
value.description: Emphasize words normally.

value.name: moderate
value.description: Sets strength of emphasis to moderate

value.name: strong
value.description: Sets strength of emphasis to strong

value.name: reduced
value.description: Effectively the opposite of emphasizing a word. For example, when the phrase 'going to' is reduced it may be spoken as 'gonna'.

property.name: voice-volume
property.description: Refers to the amplitude of the waveform output by the speech synthesiser. This may be mixed with other audio sources, influencing the perceived loudness of synthetic speech relative to these sources. Note that voice-volume does not apply to audio cues for which there is a separate means to set the relative loudness.

value.name: <number>
value.description: An integer or floating point number in the range '0' to '100'. '0' represents silence (the minimum level), and 100 corresponds to the maximum level. The volume scale is linear amplitude.

value.name: <percentage>
value.description: Percentage values are calculated relative to the inherited value, and are then clipped to the range '0' to '100'.

value.name: x-soft
value.description: Sets voice-volume to x-slow.

value.name: soft
value.description: Sets voice-volume to slow.

value.name: medium
value.description: Sets voice-volume to medium.

value.name: loud
value.description: Sets voice-volume to loud

value.name: x-loud
value.description: Sets voice-volume to x-loud.

property.name: volume
property.description: Specifies the sound volume for audio content.
property.hint: [0-100 | percentage | volume-value]. Example values: 25, 30%, soft, etc.
property.remarks: You can specify a number from 0-100 or a percentage to set the volume for this property.

value.description: Specify a value for volume that is not on this list.

value.name: silent
value.description: No sound.

value.name: x-soft
value.description: Extra-soft volume.

value.name: soft
value.description: Soft volume.

value.name: medium
value.description: Medium volume.

value.name: loud
value.description: Loud volume.

value.name: x-loud
value.description: Extra-loud volume.

property.name: white-space

browser.description: IE only supports the "pre" value for white-space.
Support for white-space is incomplete.
Opera almost has full support for the white-space attribute.
Support for white-space is incomplete.

property.description: Specifies how to handle white space characters for the element.
property.example:
For a demonstration of the white-space attribute for table columns, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/whitespace.html

value.name: normal
value.description: Collapse whitespace normally.

value.name: pre
value.description: Do not collapse whitespace.

value.name: nowrap
value.description: Collapse whitespace unless specified otherwise by an appropriate tag (e.g. br).

value.name: pre-wrap
value.description: Prevents user agents from collapsing sequences of whitespace.

value.name: pre-line
value.description: User agents should collapse sequences of whitespace.

property.name: white-space-collapse
property.description: Declares whether and how white space inside the element is collapsed.

value.name: collapse
value.description: This value directs user agents to collapse sequences of white space into a single character (or in some cases, no character).

value.name: preserve
value.description: This value prevents user agents from collapsing sequences of white space. Line breaks are preserved.

value.name: preserve-breaks
value.description: This value collapses white space as for 'collapse', but preserves line breaks.

value.name: discard
value.description: This value directs user agents to 'discard' all white space in the element.

property.name: widows
property.description: Specifies the minimum number of lines of text that an element must have left at the top of a page for printing.

property.name: width
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or as a percentage) of the content of the element.
property.example:
For additional information and a demonstration of the width attribute, see the demo page on quirksmode:

http://www.quirksmode.org/css/columns.html#width
property.remarks: width does not include the margins, padding, or borders of an element.

value.description: Specify a value for width that is not on this list.

value.name: inherit
value.description: Inherit the value from the parent element.

value.name: auto
value.description: Width to be determined by the window or parent element.

property.name: word-break
property.description: Specifies line-breaking behavior between words in the content of the element.

value.name: normal
value.description: Allows line-breaking within words.

value.name: break-all
value.description: Allows arbitrary line-breaking within words for non-Asian text. Same as 'normal' for Asian text.

value.name: keep-all
value.description: Does not allow line-breaking for Japanese, Chinese, and Korean text.

property.name: word-spacing
property.description: Specifies the amount of space between words for the element text.

property.name: word-wrap
property.description: Specifies line-breaking behavior for words that are longer than their container boundaries.

value.name: normal
value.description: Allows content to be rendered outside of its container.

value.name: break-word
value.description: Allows word-breaks for content to wrap to the next line, if necessary.

property.name: writing-mode
property.description: Specifies the direction and flow of content in the element.

value.name: lr-tb
value.description: Text flows left to right and top to bottom.

value.name: tb-rl
value.description: Text flows top to bottom and right to left, by columns.

property.name: z-index
property.description: Specifies the stacking order of the element relative to other layers. A higher z-index value will place the element above layers with lower z-index values.

property.name: zoom
property.description: Specifies the magnification scale for the element.

value.description: Specify a value for zoom that is not on this list.

value.name: normal
value.description: Element renders in normal size.

pseudo-class.name: active
pseudo-class.description: The :active pseudo-class applies while an element is being activated by the user. For example, between the times the user presses the mouse button and releases it.

pseudo-class.name: checked
pseudo-class.description: Radio and checkbox elements can be toggled by the user. Some menu items are "checked" when the user selects them. When such elements are toggled "on" the :checked pseudo-class applies. While the :checked pseudo-class is dynamic in nature, and can altered by user action, since it can also be based on the presence of semantic attributes in the document, it applies to all media.

pseudo-class.name: disabled
pseudo-class.description: The :disabled pseudo-class represents user interface elements that are in a disabled state; such elements have a corresponding enabled state.

pseudo-class.name: empty
pseudo-class.description: The :empty pseudo-class represents an element that has no children at all. In terms of the document tree, only element nodes and content nodes (such as DOM [DOM-LEVEL-3-CORE] text nodes, CDATA nodes, and entity references) whose data has a non-zero length must be considered as affecting emptiness; comments, processing instructions, and other nodes must not affect whether an element is considered empty or not.
pseudo-class.example:
p:empty is a valid representation of the following fragment:

foo:empty is not a valid representation for the following fragments: bar bla this is not :empty

pseudo-class.name: enabled
pseudo-class.description: The :enabled pseudo-class represents user interface elements that are in an enabled state; such elements have a corresponding disabled state.

pseudo-class.name: first-child
pseudo-class.description: The :first-child pseudo-class matches an element that is the first child element of some other element.

pseudo-class.name: first-of-type
pseudo-class.description: Same as :nth-of-type(1). The :first-of-type pseudo-class represents an element that is the first sibling of its type in the list of children of its parent element.

pseudo-class.name: focus
pseudo-class.description: The :focus pseudo-class applies while an element has the focus (accepts keyboard events or other forms of text input).

pseudo-class.name: hover
pseudo-class.description: The :hover pseudo-class applies while the user designates an element (with some pointing device), but does not activate it. For example, a visual user agent could apply this pseudo-class when the cursor (mouse pointer) hovers over a box generated by the element. User agents not supporting interactive media do not have to support this pseudo-class. Some conforming user agents supporting interactive media may not be able to support this pseudo-class (e.g., a pen device).

pseudo-class.name: indeterminate
pseudo-class.description:
Radio and checkbox elements can be toggled by the user, but are sometimes in an indeterminate state, neither checked nor unchecked. This can be due to an element attribute, or DOM manipulation.
A future version of this specification may introduce an :indeterminate pseudo-class that applies to such elements.

pseudo-class.name: lang
pseudo-class.description: The pseudo-class ':lang(C)' matches if the element is in language C. Whether there is a match is based solely on the identifier C being either equal to, or a hyphen-separated substring of, the element's language value, in the same way as if performed by the '|=' operator. The matching of C against the element's language value is performed case-insensitively. The identifier C does not have to be a valid language name.

value.description: See http://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry

value.name: cmn
value.description: Mandarin Chinese

value.name: fr-be
value.description: Belgian French

value.name: fr-ca
value.description: Canadian French

value.name: zh-Hans
value.description: Simplified Chinese

value.name: zh-Hant
value.description: Tranditional Chinese

pseudo-class.name: last-child
pseudo-class.description: Same as :nth-last-child(1). The :last-child pseudo-class represents an element that is the last child of some other element.

pseudo-class.name: last-of-type
pseudo-class.description: Same as :nth-last-of-type(1). The :last-of-type pseudo-class represents an element that is the last sibling of its type in the list of children of its parent element.

pseudo-class.name: link
pseudo-class.description: The :link pseudo-class applies for links that have not yet been visited.

pseudo-class.name: not
pseudo-class.description:
The negation pseudo-class, :not(X), is a functional notation taking a simple selector (excluding the negation pseudo-class itself) as an argument. It represents an element that is not represented by its argument.
Negations may not be nested; :not(:not(...)) is invalid. Note also that since pseudo-elements are not simple selectors, they are not a valid argument to :not().
pseudo-class.example:
The following selector matches all button elements in an HTML document that are not disabled.
button:not([DISABLED]) The following selector represents all but FOO elements.
*:not(FOO) The following group of selectors represents all HTML elements except links.
html|*:not(:link):not(:visited)

value.description: A simple selector

pseudo-class.name: nth-child
pseudo-class.description:
The :nth-child(an+b) pseudo-class notation represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings before it in the document tree, for any positive integer or zero value of n, and has a parent element. For values of a and b greater than zero, this effectively divides the element's children into groups of a elements (the last group taking the remainder), and selecting the bth element of each group. For example, this allows the selectors to address every other row in a table, and could be used to alternate the color of paragraph text in a cycle of four. The a and b values must be integers (positive, negative, or zero). The index of the first child of an element is 1.
In addition to this, :nth-child() can take odd and even as arguments instead. odd has the same signification as 2n+1, and even has the same signification as 2n.
The argument to :nth-child() must match the grammar below, where INTEGER matches the token [0-9]+ and the rest of the tokenization is given by the Lexical scanner in section 10.2:
nth : S* [ ['-'|'+']? INTEGER? {N} [ S* ['-'|'+'] S* INTEGER ]? | ['-'|'+']? INTEGER | {O}{D}{D} | {E}{V}{E}{N} ] S* ;

value.name: odd
value.description: Has the same signification as 2n+1.

value.name: even
value.description: Has the same signification as 2n.

pseudo-class.name: nth-last-child
pseudo-class.description: The :nth-last-child(an+b) pseudo-class notation represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings after it in the document tree, for any positive integer or zero value of n, and has a parent element. See :nth-child() pseudo-class for the syntax of its argument. It also accepts the even and odd values as arguments.
pseudo-class.example:
tr:nth-last-child(-n+2) /* represents the two last rows of an HTML table */
foo:nth-last-child(odd) /* represents all odd foo elements in their parent element, counting from the last one */

value.name: odd
value.description: Has the same signification as 2n+1.

value.name: even
value.description: Has the same signification as 2n.

pseudo-class.name: nth-last-of-type
pseudo-class.description: The :nth-last-of-type(an+b) pseudo-class notation represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings with the same expanded element name after it in the document tree, for any zero or positive integer value of n, and has a parent element. See :nth-child() pseudo-class for the syntax of its argument. It also accepts the even and odd values.

value.name: odd
value.description: Has the same signification as 2n+1.

value.name: even
value.description: Has the same signification as 2n.

pseudo-class.name: nth-of-type
pseudo-class.description: The :nth-of-type(an+b) pseudo-class notation represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings with the same expanded element name before it in the document tree, for any zero or positive integer value of n, and has a parent element. See :nth-child() pseudo-class for the syntax of its argument. It also accepts the even and odd values.
pseudo-class.example: img:nth-of-type(2n+1) { float: right; } img:nth-of-type(2n) { float: left; }

value.name: odd
value.description: Has the same signification as 2n+1.

value.name: even
value.description: Has the same signification as 2n.

pseudo-class.name: only-child
pseudo-class.description: Represents an element that has a parent element and whose parent element has no other element children. Same as :first-child:last-child or :nth-child(1):nth-last-child(1), but with a lower specificity.

pseudo-class.name: only-of-type
pseudo-class.description: Represents an element that has a parent element and whose parent element has no other element children with the same expanded element name. Same as :first-of-type:last-of-type or :nth-of-type(1):nth-last-of-type(1), but with a lower specificity.

pseudo-class.name: root
pseudo-class.description: The :root pseudo-class represents an element that is the root of the document. In HTML 4, this is always the HTML element.

pseudo-class.name: target
pseudo-class.description: A target element can be represented by the :target pseudo-class. If the document's URI has no fragment identifier, then the document has no target element.
pseudo-class.example: .note:target /* This selector represents a p element of class note that is the target element of the referring URI. */

pseudo-class.name: visited
pseudo-class.description: The :visited pseudo-class applies once the link has been visited by the user.

pseudo-element.name: after
pseudo-element.description: The ':before' and ':after' pseudo-elements can be used to insert generated content before or after an element's content.

pseudo-element.name: before
pseudo-element.description: The ':before' and ':after' pseudo-elements can be used to insert generated content before or after an element's content.

pseudo-element.name: first-letter
pseudo-element.description: The :first-letter pseudo-element must select the first letter of the first line of a block, if it is not preceded by any other content (such as images or inline tables) on its line. The :first-letter pseudo-element may be used for "initial caps" and "drop caps", which are common typographical effects. This type of initial letter is similar to an inline-level element if its 'float' property is 'none', otherwise it is similar to a floated element.

pseudo-element.name: first-line
pseudo-element.description: The :first-line pseudo-element applies special styles to the contents of the first formatted line of a paragraph.
